ASP-DAC is the largest conference in the Asia and South Pacific regions on Electronic Design Automation (EDA) for VLSI and systems, offering technical papers, tutorials, and a Designers' Forum.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - ASP-DAC 2026

The 31st Asia and South Pacific Design Automation Conference (ASP-DAC 2026) is the premier international forum for the discussion of the state-of-the-art and future trends in the field of VLSI design and design automation.

ASP-DAC 2026 will be held from **January 19-22, 2026**, at the **Hong Kong Disneyland Hotel**.

## Aims of the Conference

ASP-DAC 2026 is the 31st annual international conference on VLSI design automation in Asia and South Pacific regions, one of the most active regions of design, CAD, and fabrication of silicon chips in the world. The conference aims to provide the Asian and South Pacific CAD/DA and Design community with opportunities to present recent advances and with forums for future directions in technologies related to design and Electronic Design Automation (EDA). The format of the meeting intends to cultivate and promote an instructive and productive interchange of ideas among EDA researchers/developers and system/circuit/device designers. All scientists, engineers, and students who are interested in theoretical and practical aspects of VLSI design and design automation are welcomed to ASP-DAC.

ASP-DAC recognizes excellent contributions with the Best Paper Award and 10-Year Retrospective Most Influential Paper Award.

## Areas of Interest

Original papers in, but not limited to, the following areas are invited:

1.  **System-Level Modeling and Design Methodology**
    1.1 HW/SW co-design, co-simulation and co-verification
    1.2 System-level design exploration, synthesis, and optimization
    1.3 System-level formal verification
    1.4 System-level modeling, simulation and validation
    1.5 Networks-on-chip and NoC-based system design

2.  **Embedded, Cyberphysical (CPS), IoT Systems, and Software**
    2.1 Many- and multi-core SoC architecture
    2.2 IP/platform-based SoC design
    2.3 Real-time systems/Dependable architecture
    2.4 Cyber-physical systems and Internet of Things
    2.5 Kernel, middleware, and virtual machine
    2.6 Compiler and toolchain
    2.7 Resource allocation for heterogeneous computing platform
    2.8 Storage software and application

3.  **Memory Architecture and Near/In-Memory Computing**
    3.1 Storage system and memory architecture
    3.2 On-chip memory architectures and management: Scratchpads, compiler, controlled memories, etc.
    3.3 Memory/storage hierarchies and management for emerging memory technologies
    3.4 Near-memory and in-memory computing

4.  **Tools and Methods for Building Artificial Intelligence (AI)**
    4.1 Design methods for learning on a chip
    4.2 Tools and design methodologies for edge AI and TinyML
    4.3 Efficient ML training and inference
    *Note: papers on AI/LLM-assisted tools and design methods should be submitted to respective tracks.*

5.  **Hardware Systems and Architectures for AI**
    5.1 Hardware, device, architecture, and system-level design for deep neural networks
    5.2 Hardware acceleration for LLM
    5.3 Neural network acceleration co-design techniques
    5.4 Novel reconfigurable architectures, including FPGAs for AI/MLs

6.  **Photonic/RF/Analog-Mixed Signal Design**
    6.1 Photonic/RF/Analog-mixed signal synthesis, layout, and verification
    6.2 High-frequency electromagnetic and circuit simulations
    6.3 Mixed-signal design consideration
    6.4 Communication and computing using photonics

7.  **Approximate, Bio-Inspired and Neuromorphic Computing**
    7.1 Circuit and system techniques for approximate, hyper-dimensional, and stochastic computing
    7.2 Neuromorphic computing
    7.3 CAD for approximate and stochastic systems
    7.4 CAD for bio-inspired and neuromorphic systems

8.  **High-Level, Behavioral, and Logic Synthesis and Optimization**
    8.1 High-level/Behavioral synthesis tool and methodology
    8.2 Combinational, sequential, and asynchronous logic synthesis
    8.3 Synthesis for deep neural networks
    8.4 Technology mapping, resource scheduling, allocation, and synthesis
    8.5 Functional, logic, and timing ECO (engineering change order)
    8.6 Interaction between logic synthesis and physical design

9.  **Physical Design and Timing Analysis**
    9.1 Floorplanning, partitioning, placement, and routing optimization
    9.2 Interconnect planning and synthesis
    9.3 Clock network synthesis
    9.4 Post-layout and post-silicon optimization
    9.5 Package/PCB/3D-IC placement and routing
    9.6 Extraction, TSV, and package modeling
    9.7 Deterministic/statistical timing analysis and optimization

10. **Design for Manufacturability/Reliability and Low Power**
    10.1 Reticle enhancement, lithography-related design, and optimization
    10.2 Design for manufacturability, yield, and defect tolerance
    10.3 Reliability, robustness, aging, and soft error analysis
    10.4 Power modeling, analysis, and simulation
    10.5 Low-power design and optimization at circuit and system levels
    10.6 Thermal-aware design and dynamic thermal management
    10.7 Energy harvesting and battery management
    10.8 Signal/Power integrity, EM modeling and analysis

11. **Testing, Validation, Simulation, and Verification**
    11.1 ATPG, BIST, and DFT
    11.2 System test and 3D IC test, online test, and fault tolerance
    11.3 Memory test and repair
    11.4 RTL and gate-leveling modeling, simulation, and verification
    11.5 Circuit-level formal verification
    11.6 Device/circuit-level simulation tool and methodology

12. **Hardware and Embedded Security**
    12.1 Hardware-based security
    12.2 Detection and prevention of hardware trojans
    12.3 Side-channel attacks, fault attacks, and countermeasures
    12.4 Design and CAD for security
    12.5 Cyberphysical system security
    12.6 Nanoelectronic security
    12.7 Supply chain security and anti-counterfeiting
    12.8 Security/privacy for LLM/AI/ML

13. **Emerging Devices, Technologies and Applications**
    13.1 EDA and circuits design for quantum and Ising computing
    13.2 Nanotechnology, MEMS
    13.3 Biomedical, biochip, and biodata processing
    13.4 Edge, fog, and cloud computing
    13.5 Automotive and smart-energy systems design and optimization
    13.6 New device and process technologies

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors must submit **full-length, double-columned, original papers**, with a maximum of **6 pages** in PDF format (including the abstract, figures and tables).
*   **One page of references is allowed**, which does not count towards the 6-page limitation.
*   ASP-DAC does not allow double and/or parallel submissions of similar work to any other conferences, symposia, or journals. Extended abstracts published elsewhere may be submitted but must include sufficient new content.
*   The submission must **not include information that serves to identify the authors** of the manuscript, such as name(s) or affiliation(s) of the author(s), anywhere in the manuscript, abstract, references, and bibliographic citations.
*   While research papers with open-source software are highly encouraged where the software will be made publicly available (via GitHub or similar), the authors’ identities need to be anonymized in the submitted paper for the double-blind review process.
*   Issuing the paper as a technical report, posting the paper on a website, or presenting the paper at a workshop that does not publish formally reviewed proceedings does not disqualify it from appearing in the proceedings.
*   Each paper shall be accompanied by at least one different conference registration at the speaker’s registration rate.
*   ACM and IEEE reserve the right to exclude a paper from distribution after the conference (e.g., removal from ACM Digital Library and IEEE Xplore) if the paper is not presented at the conference by any author.

## Submission of Papers

*   **Deadline for Abstract submission:** **July 4 (Fri), 2025**, 5 PM AOE (Anywhere on earth)
*   **Deadline for PDF uploading:** **July 11 (Fri), 2025**, 5 PM AOE (Anywhere on earth)
*   **Announcement of accepted manuscript IDs:** **September 2 (Tue), 2025**
*   **Notification of acceptance:** **September 5 (Fri), 2025**
*   **Deadline for final version:** **October 31 (Fri), 2025**, 5 PM AOE (Anywhere on earth)

For detailed instructions for submission, please refer to the “Authors’ Guide” at: [https://www.aspdac.com/aspdac2026/author](https://www.aspdac.com/aspdac2026/author)

Paper submission site: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=aspdac2026](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=aspdac2026)

## ASP-DAC 2026 Chairs

*   **General Chair:** Tsung-Yi Ho (The Chinese University of Hong Kong)
*   **Technical Program Chair(s):** Takashi Sato (Kyoto University)
*   **Technical Program Vice Chair(s):** Seokhyeong Kang (Pohang University of Science and Technology)

## Panels, Special Sessions and Tutorials

Suggestions and proposals are welcome and have to be addressed to:
*   `aspdac2026-ss@aspdac.com` for special sessions & panels
*   `aspdac2026-tutorial@aspdac.com` for tutorials

Proposals must be submitted no later than **September 8 (Mon), 2025**.

## Contact

*   **Conference Secretariat:** aspdac2026 [at] aspdac.com
*   **TPC Secretariat:** aspdac2026-tpc [at] aspdac.com

The conference focuses on software testing automation, with a special theme this year on "Adapting test automation to the AI era including sustainability and emerging challenges."
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: AST 2026

The 7th ACM/IEEE International Conference on Automation of Software Test (AST 2026) will be held from **April 13-14, 2026**, in **Rio de Janeiro, Brazil**, co-located with ICSE 2026 at the Windsor Convention Center and Hotels.

## Scope

Software pervasiveness and the proliferation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies highlight the continuous need for advanced approaches to Software Quality Assurance (SQA). Software testing automation is a critical discipline encompassing test case generation, test oracles, selection criteria, and execution infrastructure engineering.

AST promotes high-quality research contributions on methods for software test automation and original case studies. We invite contributions focusing on:

*   Lessons learned from automatic testing experiments.
*   Experiences with the adoption of testing tools, methods, and techniques.
*   Best practices in testing and their measurable consequences.
*   Theoretical approaches applicable to industry.

### Theme: "Adapting test automation to the AI era including sustainability and emerging challenges"

Special sessions will focus on test automation for AI, sustainability, and AI testing education and training.

## Topics of Interest

Submissions on the AST 2026 theme are especially encouraged. Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   AI for Automated Software Testing
*   Testing of AI-based systems
*   Effective testing through explainable AI
*   Education for software testing with AI
*   Automated software testing for sustainability
*   Codeless and low-code test automation
*   Test Automation in DevOps, Agile, CI/CD flows
*   Test-driven development
*   Model-based testing
*   Formal methods and model checking for testing
*   Test case generation
*   Theoretical foundations for test automation
*   Standardization of test languages, processes, and tools
*   Security, performance, and robustness testing
*   Functional, interoperability, and conformance testing
*   Usability and user experience testing
*   Software simulation
*   Testing of embedded, reactive, and object-oriented systems
*   Test automation of large complex systems
*   Testing cyber-physical systems
*   Testing cloud and web systems and services
*   Product line testing
*   Testing anomaly detectors
*   Metrics for testing (effectiveness, efficiency, coverage)
*   Testing tools
*   Testing in various industry domains (healthcare, energy, finance, etc.)

## Submission Details

Three types of submissions are invited for both research and industry:

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 10 pages + 2 pages for references) Research Paper or Industrial Case Study.
*   **Short Papers:** (up to 4 pages + 1 page for references) Research Paper, Industrial Case Study, or Doctoral Student Research.
*   **Industrial Abstracts:** (up to 2 pages for all materials).

The submission website is [https://conf.researchr.org/signin/ast-2026/https%3A%5Es%5Esconf.researchr.org%5Eshome%5Esast-2026](https://conf.researchr.org/signin/ast-2026/https%3A%5Es%5Esconf.researchr.org%5Eshome%5Esast-2026).

### Requirements:

*   Page limits are strict; no additional pages can be purchased.
*   Submissions must conform to the **IEEE conference proceedings template**. For guidelines, visit: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   Submissions must be original, unpublished work, and not under review elsewhere.
*   AST 2026 follows a **double-blind review process**.
*   Accepted papers will be published in the ICSE 2026 Co-located Event Proceedings and included in the IEEE and ACM Digital Libraries.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Submission Deadline:** 26 October 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** 05 January 2026
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** 26 January 2026
*   **Conference Dates:** 13-14 April 2026

## Registration

Registration details can be found at: [https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2026/registration](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2026/registration)

## Special Issue

Authors of the best papers will be invited to submit an extended version for a special issue.

callForPapers:
# ASSETS 2025: Call for Papers

The ASSETS conference is the premier forum for presenting research on the design, evaluation, use, and education related to computing for people with disabilities and older adults. We invite high-quality original submissions on topics relevant to computing and accessibility.

Submissions should present significant contributions to design, systems, tools, scientific understanding, methodology, or social issues. Relevant topics include (but are not limited to) new enabling technologies, studies of how technologies are used by people with disabilities, explorations of barriers to access, and evaluations of accessibility education methods. We recommend that papers with a technical contribution be validated through research activities with representative users when possible.

All Technical Papers and Posters and Demonstrations submissions are peer-reviewed by an international Program Committee. Accepted papers and the abstracts for posters and demonstrations, experience reports, and the student research competition will be archived in the ACM Digital Library. At least one author of accepted submissions must register as the presenter by the early registration deadline.

## Submission Procedures

*   [Technical Papers](technical_papers.html)
*   Posters and Demonstrations
*   Workshops
*   Experience Reports
*   Mentoring
*   Doctoral Consortium
*   [Student Research Competition](student_research_competition.html)

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **11:59 P.M. Anywhere on Earth (UTC -12:00)**.

### Mentoring

*   **Priority Deadline to request a mentor:** Thursday, February 20, 2025
*   **Late Deadline to request a mentor:** Wednesday, March 12, 2025

### Technical Papers

*   **Rebuttal Phase Opens:** Wednesday, May 28, 2025
*   **Rebuttal Phase Closes:** Wednesday, June 4, 2025
*   **Acceptance Decisions Sent to Authors:** Wednesday, June 18, 2025

### Posters and Demonstrations

*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Wednesday, July 30, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Wednesday, August 6, 2025
*   **Video Presentations Submission Deadline:** Wednesday, August 20, 2025

### Workshops

*   **Submission Deadline:** Wednesday, June 11, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Wednesday, July 9, 2025
*   **Workshop Websites Online:** Wednesday, July 16, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** Wednesday, July 16, 2025
*   **Acceptances to Workshop Attendees Sent Out:** Friday, August 15, 2025
*   **In-person Workshops:** Sunday, October 26, 2025

### Experience Reports

*   **Submission Deadline:** Wednesday, June 11, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Wednesday, July 9, 2025
*   **Final Versions Due:** Wednesday, July 16, 2025
*   **Video Presentations Submission Deadline:** Wednesday, July 23, 2025

### Doctoral Consortium

All deadlines are **11:59 P.M. Anywhere on Earth (UTC -12:00)**.

*   **Student's Cover Letter, Research Project Summary, and CV Submission Deadline:** Sunday, June 29, 2025

summary: The 17th International Conference on Advanced Visual Interfaces (AVI 2024) was held in Arenzano (Genoa), Italy, from June 3rd to 7th, 2024. The conference focused on the conception, design, implementation, and evaluation of novel visual interfaces and Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) topics. Accepted papers are published in the ACM International Conference Proceeding Series (ICPS) and available in the ACM Digital Library. The next AVI edition will be held in Venice.
callForPapers:
# AVI 2024: Call for Papers

The 17th International Conference on Advanced Visual Interfaces (AVI 2024) took place from **June 3rd to 7th, 2024, in Arenzano (Genoa), Italy**.

## Submission Types and Deadlines

### Long and Short Papers
*   **Abstract Submission:** Wednesday, January 17, 2024
*   **Paper Submission:** Wednesday, January 24, 2024
*   **Notification:** March 5, 2024

### Posters and Demos
*   **Submission:** Friday, March 8, 2024

### Doctoral Consortium Papers
*   **Submission:** Friday, March 15, 2024

### Workshops & Tutorials
*   **Workshop Proposals:** Friday, December 1, 2023
*   **Tutorial Proposals:** Friday, March 15, 2024

## Submission Instructions

*   **Submission Platform:** The submission process is managed through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=avi2024](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=avi2024)
*   **Abstract:** A 250-word abstract is requested before paper submission.
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be anonymized. Remove any information that could reveal the authors' identity. Citation to authors' previous work should not be anonymous and should be in the third person in the text, e.g., "As described by [10]" and not "As described in our previous work [10]".
*   **Auxiliary Materials:** Authors are allowed to upload auxiliary materials and short videos (not exceeding 2 minutes). However, papers should be self-contained. Auxiliary material must also be anonymized.

## Formatting

*   All submissions must be formatted according to the **ACM SIGCONF template**.
*   **Latex:** [SIGCONF template via Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/association-for-computing-machinery-acm-sig-proceedings-template/bmvfhcdnxfty)
*   **Word:** [ACM Interim Template](https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template) (Recommended updated template for submission and mandatory for camera-ready)
*   **Format:** The required format is **double-column**.

## Paper Length

*   **Long Papers:** Maximum 8 pages (+1 for references).
*   **Short Papers:** Maximum 4 pages (+1 for references).
*   **Poster Papers:** Up to 2 pages (+1 for references), not anonymized.
*   **Demo Papers:** Up to 2 pages (+1 for references), not anonymized.

## Proceedings

Accepted papers will be published in the ACM International Conference Proceeding Series (ICPS) and will be available in the ACM Digital Library.

For each accepted paper, at least one author must register to AVI 2024 by the early registration deadline for authors and present the paper at the Conference.

## Topics of Interest (Long and Short Research Papers)

We solicit high-quality original research papers in the area of advanced visual interfaces and Human-Computer Interaction in general. Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Adaptive and Context-Aware Interfaces
*   Affective Visual Interfaces
*   Computer Supported Cooperative Work
*   Conversational Interfaces
*   Full-body Interaction
*   Human-AI Interaction
*   Visual Interfaces for Human-Centered AI Systems
*   Information Visualization
*   Intelligent Interfaces
*   Creative AI for advanced visual interfaces
*   Engineering of Visual Interfaces and Interaction
*   Interaction Design Tools
*   Generative AI for the design and development of visual interfaces
*   Building Interactions: Hardware, Materials, and Fabrication
*   Interaction for the environment and environmental awareness
*   Interface Metaphors
*   Interfaces for Automotive
*   Interfaces for Big Data
*   Interfaces for e-Commerce and e-Branding
*   Interfaces for e-Culture and e-Tourism
*   Interfaces for End-User Development
*   Interfaces for i-TV
*   Interfaces for Recommender Systems
*   Interfaces for Social Interaction and Cooperation
*   Interfaces and Interactions for Inclusion, Accessibility and Aging
*   Interfaces for Children
*   Learning, Education, and Families
*   Mobile Interaction
*   Motion-based Interaction
*   Multimodal Interfaces
*   (Multi)Sensory Interfaces
*   (Multi)Touch Interaction
*   Search Interfaces
*   Shape-Changing Devices
*   User Interfaces for the Internet of Things
*   Usability and Accessibility
*   Usability and (Cyber)Security
*   Virtual and Augmented Reality
*   Visual Analytics

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 36th British Machine Vision Conference (BMVC 2025) is one of the major international conferences on computer vision and related areas, organized by the British Machine Vision Association (BMVA). BMVC 2025 will be an **in-person event** held from **24th - 27th November 2025** in **Sheffield, UK**.

We invite submissions of high-quality papers in image processing, computer vision, machine learning, and related areas. Submitted papers will be refereed on originality, presentation, empirical results, and evaluation quality. Accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings, published and DOI-indexed by BMVA. Past proceedings are online at the [BMVA proceedings website](https://britishmachinevisionassociation.github.io/bmvc).

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   3D from X
*   3D Shape modeling and processing
*   Action and event understanding
*   Adversarial attack and defense
*   Architecture and Space Design
*   Biometrics
*   Brave new ideas (not beating SOA but a new approach, theory, niche)
*   Computational Photography and Photogrammetry
*   Computer vision theory
*   Datasets and Evaluation
*   Deep learning architectures and techniques
*   Document analysis and understanding
*   Embodied vision: Active agents; simulation
*   Explainable AI
*   Fairness, privacy, ethics, social-good, transparency, accountability in vision
*   Generative models
*   Humans: Face, Gestures, Pose and Body Movement
*   Human-in-the-loop computer vision
*   Image Retrieval
*   Low-level and Physics-based Vision
*   Machine learning (other than deep learning)
*   Medical and Biological Image Analysis
*   Motion estimation and tracking
*   Multimodal learning
*   Recognition for X
*   Representation Learning
*   RGBD sensors and analytics
*   Scene Analysis and Understanding
*   Segmentation, grouping and shape analysis
*   Self-, semi-, meta-, unsupervised learning
*   Transfer, low-shot, continual, long-tail learning
*   Video analysis and Understanding
*   Vision and audio
*   Vision and graphics
*   Vision and language
*   Vision and robotics
*   Vision applications and systems
*   Visual reasoning and logical representation

Papers submitted under the “Brave new ideas” subject area are expected to move away from incremental benchmark gains. Proposed ideas should radically differ from the current research strand or propose a novel problem.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers should not exceed **NINE pages** (references are excluded).
*   Appendices should be submitted via the supplementary information.
*   The submission portal is available via [OpenReview](https://openreview.net/group?id=bmva.org/BMVC/2025/Conference).
*   BMVC will **not have a rebuttal period** this year.
*   Further guidance for authors can be found in the [Author Guidelines](/authors/author-guidelines/) page.
*   Authors are asked to be prepared to review papers. Failure to engage with the reviewing process might be grounds for rejection.

## Important Dates

Please note all deadlines are at **23:59 GMT**.

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** Tuesday, 13 May 2025
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** Friday, 16 May 2025
*   **Supplementary Material Submission:** Friday, 16 May 2025
*   **Author Notifications:** Friday, 25 July 2025
*   **Camera Ready for Papers:** Friday, 29 August 2025

## Reviewing Process

*   Each paper will be reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   An Area Chair will provide a meta-review, summarizing the reviewers’ points and recommending paper decisions.
*   Due to the anticipated volume of papers, there will be **NO extension** granted to the submission deadline.

## Publication

*   Accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings, published and DOI-indexed by BMVA.
*   Top papers from BMVC 2025 will be invited to submit extended versions to a special issue of the International Journal of Computer Vision (IJCV).

## Contact

Any queries to the Programme Chairs should be sent to [programmechairs.bmvc2025@bmva.org](mailto:programmechairs.bmvc2025@bmva.org).

summary: The 21st IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025) will take place from August 17-21, 2025, in Los Angeles, California, USA, focusing on Secured and Trustworthy Automation. The conference serves as a primary forum for cross-industry and multidisciplinary research in automation.
callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE) 2025: Call for Papers

The 21st IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025) will be held in **Los Angeles, California, USA**, from **August 17 – August 21, 2025**. Pre-conference workshops are scheduled for **August 17, 2025**.

### Focus:

CASE 2025 will focus on **Secured and Trustworthy Automation**. Automation systems are increasingly reliant on security and trustworthiness, especially in areas like collaborative robotics, self-operating systems, smart manufacturing, healthcare, farming, transportation, logistics, and smart cities. Research is crucial to address vulnerabilities and biases stemming from system design, data collection, machine learning, or control.

## Topics of Interest

The conference will cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

*   Systems
*   Automation
*   Autonomous Systems
*   Discrete Event Systems
*   Smart Cities
*   Robotics
*   Building Automation
*   Automation in Meso, Micro and Nano-scale
*   Big Data
*   Machine Learning
*   Information and Communication Technologies

## Submission Categories

CASE 2025 invites proposals for special sessions, workshops/tutorials, regular papers, industry papers, and presentation-only papers.

### Regular Paper

*   **Page Limit:** Six (6) pages. Two (2) additional pages are permitted at an extra charge. Papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** PDF, adhering to the standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Submission:** Via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/).
*   **Publication:** All accepted regular papers will be included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Deadline:** March 15, 2025 (final).

### Special Session Paper

*   **Page Limit:** Six (6) pages. Two (2) additional pages are permitted at an extra charge. Papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** PDF, adhering to the standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Submission:** Via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/), using the specific special session code.
*   **Publication:** Included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Deadline:** March 15, 2025 (final).

### Special Session Abstract

*   **Page Limit:** Two (2) pages. Abstracts exceeding 2 pages will be returned without review.
*   **Format:** PDF.
*   **Submission:** Via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/), using the specific special session code.
*   **Publication:** Accepted abstracts will have oral presentations at the conference but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore or be indexed.
*   **Deadline:** April 15, 2025.

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers

*   **Page Limit:** Four (4) pages.
*   **Format:** PDF, adhering to the standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Submission:** Via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/).
*   **Publication:** These papers will have oral presentations but will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore or be indexed.
*   **Deadline:** April 15, 2025.

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers for Special Sessions

*   **Page Limit:** Four (4) pages.
*   **Format:** PDF, adhering to the standard IEEE double-column format.
*   **Submission:** Via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/), using the special session code.
*   **Publication:** Oral presentations only; not in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Deadline:** April 1, 2025.

### T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM Presentation

*   Authors of papers published in eligible IEEE Robotics & Automation Society journals (T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L, RAM) can present their work at CASE 2025.
*   **Submission:** As a "Presentation-only paper" via the [RAS Papercept submission portal](https://ras.papercept.net/). No further review is required.
*   **Publication:** Oral presentations only; not in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Eligibility Window:** Paper must be transferred between December 1, 2024, and May 2, 2025.
*   **Deadline:** April 30, 2025.

## Key Dates

*   **Special session proposal submission:** February 15, 2025 (Extended)
*   **Regular and special session full paper submission:** March 15, 2025 (Final)
*   **Industry paper and work-in-progress paper submission:** April 15, 2025 (Extended)
*   **Workshop/tutorial proposal submission:** April 30, 2025
*   **T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM presentation submission:** April 30, 2025
*   **Paper acceptance notification:** May 30, 2025
*   **Early bird registration:** June 13, 2025
*   **Final paper submission and author registration:** June 27, 2025

## Guidelines for Authors

*   **Templates:** Download LaTeX or MS-Word templates from [here](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/ieeeconf.zip) and [here](https://2025.ieeecase.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/643/Template-for-Preparation-of-Papers-for-IEEE-Sponsored-Conferences.docx).
*   **Language:** English.
*   **Format:** Standard IEEE 2-column format. Only PDF files will be accepted.
*   **Review Process:** Single-blind review system (author identities known to reviewers, reviewer identities not disclosed).
*   **Plagiarism:** All submissions will be checked for similarity using iThenticate.
*   **Generative AI:** Manuscripts generated by generative AI language tools are prohibited. Partial use requires full reference. AI tools cannot be listed as authors. Light editing for spelling/grammar is permissible with acknowledgment.

## Contact Information

*   **Official Contact Email:** [case2025@usc.edu](mailto:case2025@usc.edu)

callForPapers:
# ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS) 2025: Call for Papers

The 32nd ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS) seeks submissions presenting novel contributions related to all real-world aspects of computer security and privacy. CCS has two review cycles in 2025.

## Review Cycles and Decisions

For each submission, one of the following decisions will be made:

*   **Accept:** Papers in this category will be accepted for publication in the proceedings and presentation at the conference, possibly after making minor changes with the oversight of a shepherd.
*   **Minor revision:** Papers in this category are considered promising but need some minor additional work. Authors will be given the opportunity to resubmit such papers, with appropriate revisions. The revised paper will then be re-evaluated.
*   **Reject:** Papers in this category are declined for inclusion in the conference. Papers rejected from the first review cycle may not be submitted again to the second review cycle.

Authors of each accepted paper must ensure that at least one author registers for the conference, and that their paper is presented in-person at the conference if at all possible.

## Paper Submission Information

*   All submissions must be received by 11:59 PM AoE (UTC-12) on the day of the corresponding deadline.
*   Submitted papers must not substantially overlap with papers that have been published or accepted for publication, or that are simultaneously in submission to a journal, conference, or workshop with published proceedings.
*   All submissions should be properly anonymized. Papers should avoid revealing authors’ identity in the text. When referring to their previous work, authors are required to cite their papers in the third person, without identifying themselves. Papers not properly anonymized may be rejected without review.
*   Authors may submit up to a maximum of 7 papers for Cycle B.
*   Submitted papers will be evaluated based on their merits, particularly their importance to practical aspects of computer and communications security and privacy, novelty, quality of execution, and presentation.
*   For papers that might raise ethical concerns, authors are expected to convince reviewers that proper procedures (such as IRB approval or responsible disclosure) have been followed.
*   No modifications to the author list on a paper may be made after submission.

## Mandatory Reviewing

Authors submitting 3 papers or more may be required to submit reviews for other papers at CCS 2025. Failure to provide requested information may result in desk rejection.

## Withdrawing Policy

A paper can be withdrawn at any point before the reviews have been sent to the authors. Once the reviews have been sent, the paper cannot be withdrawn.

## Paper Format

*   Submissions must be a PDF file in double-column ACM format using "sigconf" 2-column format.
*   Maximum length: 12 pages, excluding the bibliography, well-marked appendices, and supplementary material.
*   Reviewers are not required to read the appendices or any supplementary material.
*   Authors should not change the font or the margins of the ACM format.
*   Submissions not following the required format may be rejected without review.

## Providing Artifacts at Submission Time

Submissions whose claimed contributions rely on artifacts (e.g., code, models, data sets) are expected to make these accessible to the reviewers, unless there are good reasons not to.

## Optional Artifact Evaluation

Authors of accepted papers are encouraged to submit artifacts for an optional Artifact Evaluation (AE) process.

## Conference Tracks

CCS features a multi-track format. Authors must select one track at the time of submission.

*   **Program Co-Chairs:** David Lie (University of Toronto), Véronique Cortier (CNRS, Loria)
*   **Software Security Track Chairs:** Alexandra Dmitrienko, Yinqian Zhang
*   **Web Security Track Chairs:** Yinzhi Cao
*   **Network Security Track Chairs:** Kun Sun
*   **Security Usability and Measurement Track Chairs:** Emiliano De Cristofaro, Yixin Zou
*   **Machine Learning and Security Track Chairs:** Neil Gong, Elissa Redmiles, Ben Y. Zhao
*   **Formal Methods and Programming Languages Track Chairs:** Tamara Rezk
*   **Hardware, Side Channels, and Cyber Physical Systems Track Chairs:** Christopher Fletcher, Mengjia Yan
*   **Applied Cryptography Track Chairs:** Marc Fischlin, Dominique Schroeder
*   **Blockchain and Distributed Systems Track Chairs:** Sisi Duan
*   **Privacy and Anonymity Track Chairs:** Catuscia Palamidessi

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors must report all program-committee members who, in their opinion, have a conflict of interest. Mandatory declared conflicts include current or former doctoral advisor/advisee, members of the same institution, close family members, and recent co-authors (within the past 2 years).

## Policy for Peer-Review Integrity

All submissions must adhere to ACM policies against harassment and the ACM Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct.

## Important Dates

### First Review Cycle

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** Jan 2, 2025
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** Jan 9, 2025
*   **Notification of early-rejection papers:** Feb 10, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** Mar 3—6, 2025
*   **Author notification:** Mar 28, 2025

### Second Review Cycle

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** April 7, 2025
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** April 14, 2025
*   **Notification of early-rejection papers:** May 16, 2025
*   **Author rebuttal period:** June 7—12, 2025
*   **Author notification:** July 1, 2025

## Submission Site

*   Cycle A: [https://ccs2025a.hotcrp.com/](https://ccs2025a.hotcrp.com/)
*   Cycle B: [https://ccs2025b.hotcrp.com/](https://ccs2025b.hotcrp.com/)

## Diversity and Inclusion

ACM CCS is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion. Authors are encouraged to be mindful of language and examples that could marginalize or stereotype any group. Reviewers will also monitor and demand changes if such issues arise in submissions.

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers: IEEE International Symposium on Cluster, Cloud and Internet Computing (CCGrid)

The IEEE International Symposium on Cluster, Cloud, and Internet Computing (CCGrid) is a leading forum for disseminating and discussing research activities in distributed systems. CCGrid 2025 will be held from **May 19 to 22, 2025**, in **Tromsø, Norway**. The conference aims to foster discussion on a broad range of topics related to computing clusters, widely distributed clouds, and Internet computing paradigms (like fog/edge computing for IoT), with applications to societal challenges such as sustainability, security, and AI.

## Topics of Interest

Specific topics of interest include but are not limited to the following:

*   **Track 1: Hardware Systems and Networking**: hardware architecture, networking of data centers, virtualized hardware, Open hardware architectures.
*   **Track 2: Software Systems and Platforms**: Programming models and runtime systems, resource management and scheduling, service-oriented architectures, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, monitoring and evaluation tools, analysis of system/application performance.
*   **Track 3: Machine Learning (ML) for Systems and Systems for ML**: abstraction, architecture, design, and implementation supporting machine learning and artificial intelligence applications; use of ML/AI applications to enhance performance of cluster, cloud, and Internet-computing systems; ML/AI techniques for workload prediction, application scheduling, resource placement, and resilience.
*   **Track 4: Future Compute Continuum and Seamless Ecosystems**: Internet computing frontiers, Future Internet, Osmotic computing, Post- and Non-Von Neumann computing, Quantum computing.
*   **Track 5: Sustainable IT Systems**: abstraction, architecture, design, and implementation; ultra-low power systems architectures; optimization and analysis in green computing; environment-friendly computing ecosystems; power, cooling, and thermal awareness; green edge, IoT, Cloud, datacenter, and supercomputers.
*   **Track 6: Applications and Workflows**: Data science, Machine learning and artificial intelligence applications, Cyber-physical systems, e-Health, Internet of Things (IoT)-enabled smart systems and applications.

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit papers electronically via the submission link: [https://site.uit.no/ccgrid2025/paper-submission/](https://site.uit.no/ccgrid2025/paper-submission/)

*   **Peer Review**: All manuscripts will be peer-reviewed and evaluated based on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and relevance to conference topics.
*   **Double-Blind Submission**: Submissions need to be double-blinded. Authors should not reveal their identity in their submissions. References to past work must be in a third-person form.
*   **Length Limit**: Submitted manuscripts should not exceed **10 letter size pages** (8.5 x 11, IEEE format for conference proceedings), including figures, tables, and references. Authors may purchase up to two additional pages beyond the original 10 pages (excluding references) for the final accepted manuscript.
*   **Originality**: Original unpublished research that is not currently under review for any other conference or journal is expected. Papers under active review elsewhere will be rejected without review.
*   **Format**: Submissions must adhere to the IEEE format for conference proceedings.
*   **Publication**: The proceedings will be published through the IEEE Press and made available online through the IEEE Digital Library.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **Anywhere on Earth (AoE, UTC-12 timezone)**.

*   **Paper abstract deadline:** December 9, 2024
*   **Paper submission deadline:** December 23, 2024
*   **Author notification:** February 17, 2025
*   **Camera ready deadline:** March 14, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** May 19 - 22, 2025

## Contact Information

For any inquiries, please contact: [ccgrid2025@uit.no](mailto:ccgrid2025@uit.no)

## Further Information

For detailed information regarding specific tracks, submission instructions, and the SCALE challenge, please visit the official conference website: [https://site.uit.no/ccgrid2025/](https://site.uit.no/ccgrid2025/)

callForPapers:
# CHIRA 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Computer-Human Interaction Research and Applications (CHIRA) aims to bring together professionals, academics, and students interested in the advancement of research and practical applications in computer-human interaction.

CHIRA 2025 will be held from **May 18, 2025 to May 22, 2025** in **Nice, France**, and is sponsored by INSTICC.

### Onsite and Online Options

Although the conference is returning to its in-person format, speakers unable to travel will be allowed to present remotely (hybrid support).

### Scope

The conference covers different aspects of Computer-Human Interaction, including Human Factors and Information Systems, Interactive Devices, Interaction Design, and Adaptive and Intelligent Systems. Papers describing original work on advanced methods, prototypes, systems, tools, and techniques, as well as survey papers indicating future directions, are encouraged.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Human Factors for Interactive Systems, Research, and Applications**
    *   User Preferences and Customization
    *   Security and Privacy
    *   User Behaviour Analysis
    *   Modelling Human Factors
    *   User Experience Evaluation
    *   Decision Support Systems
    *   Human-Centered AI
    *   Collaborative Systems
    *   Healthcare Applications
    *   User Experience
    *   Entertainment
    *   Social Computing
    *   Human-in-the-loop
2.  **Interactive Devices**
    *   Metaverse
    *   Conversational Speech Interfaces
    *   3D Interaction
    *   Virtual, Augmented, Mixed, and Extended Reality
    *   Wearable Sensors
    *   Mobile Devices and Services
    *   Human-Robot Interaction
    *   Brain-Computer Interfaces
    *   Gesture-Based Interaction
    *   EEG Signal Processing
3.  **Interaction Design**
    *   User Experience Design
    *   Accessible and Adaptive Interaction
    *   Design and Evaluation
    *   Interaction Design Modelling
    *   Collaboration and Interaction Design
    *   Mobile Computer-Human Interaction
    *   User-Centered Interaction Design Patterns
    *   Cognitive Interaction
    *   Affective Computing
    *   Multimedia and Multimodal Interaction
4.  **Adaptive and Intelligent Systems**
    *   Visualization Tools
    *   Information Retrieval
    *   Computational Interaction
    *   Context-Aware Systems
    *   Intelligent User Interfaces
    *   Cognition, Communication and Interaction
    *   Machine Learning
    *   Deep Learning
    *   Explainable AI (XAI)
    *   Artificial Intelligence

## Keynote Speaker

*   Alice Chirico, Catholic University of Sacred Hearth, Italy

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Types:

*   **Regular Paper:** Completed and validated research.
*   **Position Paper:** Work in progress or an arguable opinion.
*   **Abstract:** For works presented but not published in proceedings.

### Submission Guidelines:

*   Papers must be in English, checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Submissions must address one or several conference areas/topics.
*   **Double-blind paper evaluation method:** Papers must be submitted WITHOUT any reference to authors' identities, including personal details or acknowledgments.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.
*   All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform PRIMORIS.
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates.
*   Accepted file formats: .pdf or .doc.

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published by **Springer** in the conference proceedings (CCIS Series).

Proceedings will be submitted for evaluation for indexing by: Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index, DBLP, Google Scholar, EI-Compendex, INSPEC, JST, Norwegian Register for Scientific Journals and Series, Mathematical Reviews, SCImago, Scopus, and zbMATH.

## Important Dates

Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth"

*   **Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: June 6, 2025 (expired)
    *   Authors Notification: July 17, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: July 31, 2025
*   **Position Papers / Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: July 3, 2025 (expired)
    *   Authors Notification: July 31, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: September 5, 2025
*   **Late-Breaking:**
    *   Paper Submission: July 24, 2025

    *   Camera Ready and Registration: September 11, 2025
*   **Workshops:**

*   **Special Sessions:**
    *   Special Session Proposal: May 27, 2025 (expired)

    *   Tutorial Proposal: September 11, 2025
*   **Demos:**
    *   Demo Proposal: September 11, 2025
*   **Panels:**
    *   Panel Proposal: September 11, 2025
*   **Abstracts Track:**
    *   Abstract Submission: July 31, 2025
    *   Authors Notification: September 8, 2025
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: September 17, 2025

## Secretariat

Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
Tel.: +351 265 520 184
Fax: +351 265 520 186
e-mail: [chira.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:chira.secretariat@insticc.org)

The conference will take place at the Barceló Marbella hotel, located in the heart of the Costa del Sol.

# CISIS 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th International Conference on Computational Intelligence in Security for Information Systems (CISIS 2025) aims to bring together academic and industry researchers in the fields of Computational Intelligence, Information Security, and Data Mining. The conference focuses on the need for intelligent, flexible behaviour in large, complex systems, particularly in mission-critical domains.

CISIS 2025 will be held in **Salamanca, Spain**, from **October 16-17, 2025**. This is an ON-SITE event and is part of the International Joint Conferences HAIS-SOCO-CISIS-ICEUTE & STARTUP OLÉ 2025.

## Topics of Interest

*   Computational Intelligence
*   Information Security
*   Data Mining
*   Intelligent and flexible behaviour for large, complex systems, especially in mission-critical domains.

## Submission & Publication

*   **Submission Platform:** All submissions should be made through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2024](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=cisis2024)
*   **Publication:** CISIS’25 Proceedings will be published by **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems (TENTATIVE)** and archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library.

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** **15th March 2025**
*   **Paper submission deadline:** **1st June 2025**
*   **Acceptance notification:** **15th June 2025**
*   **Submission of revised papers:** **30th June 2025**
*   **Final version submission:** **5th July 2025**
*   **Payment deadline:** **10th July 2025**
*   **Conference dates:** **16th – 17th October 2025**

## Conference Chairs

*   **General Chair:** Emilio Corchado (University of Salamanca)
*   **Co-Chairs:**
    *   Héctor Quintián (University of A Coruña)
    *   ALICIA TRONCOSO LORA (Pablo de Olavide University)
    *   HILDE PÉREZ GARCÍA (University of León)
    *   ESTEBAN JOVE (University of A Coruña)
    *   José Luis Calvo Rolle (University of A Coruña)
    *   FRANCISCO JAVIER MARTÍNEZ DE PISÓN (University of La Rioja)
    *   PABLO GARCÍA BRINGAS (University of Deusto)
    *   FRANCISCO MARTÍNEZ ÁLVAREZ (Pablo de Olavide University)
    *   Álvaro Herrero Cosio (University of Burgos)
    *   PAOLO FOSCI (University of Bergamo)

## Collocated Events

CISIS 2025 is held in conjunction with:

*   20th International Conference on Hybrid Artificial Intelligence Systems (HAIS 2025)
*   16th International Conference on EUropean Transnational Educational (ICEUTE 2025)
*   20th International Conference on Soft Computing Models in Industrial and Environmental Applications (SOCO 2025)
*   STARTUP OLÉ 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The **29th International Conference on Implementation and Application of Automata (CIAA 2025)** will be held from **September 22-25, 2025**, in **Palermo, Italy**.

The purpose of CIAA is to bring together members of the academic, research, and industrial community who have an interest in the theory, implementation, and application of automata and related structures. The conference concerns research on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects.

## Topics

We solicit papers on all aspects of implementation and application of automata and related structures, including theoretical aspects, including but not limited to:

*   Algorithms on automata
*   Automata and logic
*   Bioinformatics
*   Complexity of automata operations
*   Compilers
*   Computer-aided verification
*   Concurrency
*   Data structure design for automata
*   Data and image compression
*   Design and architecture of automata software
*   Digital libraries
*   DNA, molecular, and membrane computing
*   Document engineering
*   Editors, environments
*   Experimental studies and practical experiences
*   Industrial applications
*   Natural language processing
*   Networking
*   New algorithms for manipulating automata
*   Object-oriented modeling
*   Pattern-matching
*   Quantum computing
*   Speech and speaker recognition
*   Structured and semi-structured documents
*   Symbolic manipulation environments for automata
*   Teaching
*   Text processing
*   Techniques for graphical display of automata
*   VLSI
*   Viruses, related phenomena
*   World-wide-web

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must be written in LaTeX using the **LNCS LaTeX2e style**.
*   Papers must not exceed **12 single-spaced pages**, excluding the title page and the references.
*   If authors believe that more details are essential to substantiate the main claims, they may include a clearly marked appendix that will be read at the discretion of the program committee.
*   Simultaneous submissions of papers to journals or any other conference with published proceedings or submitting previously published papers is **not allowed**.
*   Only electronic submission of **PDF documents** is possible.
*   Authors should submit their contributions through Easychair: [Submit here](https://ciaa2025.unipa.it/registration/)

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** May 16th (AoE)
*   **Notification deadline:** June 23rd
*   **Final version deadline:** June 30th
*   **Early registration deadline:** until July 21st
*   **Late registration deadline:** September 18th

## Publication

CIAA 2025 proceedings will be published in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)**.

## Special Issue

Extended versions of selected papers from the conference will be invited for consideration in a special issue of **International Journal of Foundations of Computer Science (IJFCS)**.

callForPapers:
# IC2E 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE International Conference on Cloud Engineering (IC2E) is a premier conference on Cloud Computing. IC2E 2025 will be held from **September 23-26, 2025, in Rennes, France**.

The conference provides a high-quality, comprehensive forum where researchers and practitioners can exchange information on engineering principles, enabling technologies, and practical experiences related to Cloud Computing. This year, a particular focus will be given to **sustainable Cloud computing and Cloud for sustainability**, while other topics are also welcome.

## Submission Tracks

Authors can choose to submit their papers under either the **Research and Vision Track** or the **Industry and Experience Track**.

## Topics of Interest

Submissions are invited on the following non-exhaustive list of topics for both tracks:

*   Sustainability concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack and on all parts of Cloud systems
*   Cloud systems for sustainability, e.g., sustainable Cloud systems for environment modeling and monitoring
*   Cloud management and engineering, from single (micro-)services to complete system landscapes
*   Cloud applications, ranging from the Internet of Things (IoT) over Big Data to Machine Learning
*   Cloud systems, including storage, data distribution, and serverless computing
*   Cloud security and privacy concerns on all levels of the Cloud stack
*   Fog and Edge Computing, and all other system types in the Cloud-Edge Compute Continuum
*   Everything as a Service
*   Non-technical aspects of Cloud Computing, e.g., Cloud governance or cloud economics

## Paper Types

IC2E is looking for the following three types of paper submissions:

*   **Research papers:** Describe original well-evaluated research. Novelty is a key criterion.
*   **Vision papers:** Describe speculative but well-reasoned and inspiring papers. Clarity of vision is key.
*   **Industry and experience papers:** Describe how existing research has been transferred into practice. Lessons learned are important.

Research and vision papers should be submitted to the Research Track. Industry and experience papers should be submitted to the Industry Track. Vision papers should have "(Vision Paper)" as a subtitle on the first page.

## Submission Instructions

*   Paper submissions should be **single-blind**.
*   Authors must submit full and short papers in PDF via the web submission form: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ic2e2025)
*   Both Research Track and Industry Track papers should use the **IEEE Manuscript Template for Conference Proceedings**.
    *   LaTeX users must use `\documentclass[10pt,conference]{IEEEtran}`.

### Paper Formatting:

*   **Full papers:**
    *   **For reviewing:** Not exceed 9 double-column pages (excluding references).
    *   **For final published version:** Limited to a total of 12 double-column pages (including everything).
*   **Short papers:**
    *   **For reviewing:** Limited to 5 pages (excluding references). Clearly mark as "Short Paper" in the title.
    *   **For final published version:** Limited to 8 pages (including everything).

IC2E strongly encourages authors to publish software and data sets as open-source/data, supporting Open Science practices.

## Review Process and Publication

All submitted manuscripts will be peer-reviewed based on correctness, originality, technical strength, significance, quality of presentation, and relevance to the conference scope. Submitted manuscripts must contain original contributions not under consideration elsewhere.

Accepted papers will be published by the IEEE Computer Society Conference Publishing Services (EI indexed).

Authors are responsible for ensuring the complete author list is registered in Easychair. The author list cannot be changed in the final manuscript.

Papers that include text and/or images generated from a large-scale language model (LLM) such as ChatGPT are prohibited unless explicitly identified as such in the paper.

IC2E 2025 is planned as an in-person event. Authors of accepted papers are expected to arrange for an in-person attendee to present the paper.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** May 1st, 2025 (AoE, firm deadline)
*   **Full and short paper submission deadline:** May 8th, 2025 (AoE, firm deadline)
*   **Author notification and start of shepherding phase:** June 23rd, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copies:** July 31st, 2025

## Calls for Other Contributions

*   [Call for Workshops](cfp-workshops.html)
*   [Call for Tutorials](cfp-tutorials.html)
*   [Call for Demos and Posters](cfp-demos-posters.html)

# HCOMP 2024: Call for Papers

The Twelfth AAAI Conference on Human Computation and Crowdsourcing (HCOMP 2024) will be held from **October 16–19, 2024**, in **Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania**. The conference theme is **"Responsible Crowd Work for Better AI."**

HCOMP is the premier venue for disseminating the latest research findings on human computation and crowdsourcing, fostering interdisciplinary research across fields such as human-centered qualitative studies, HCI design, social computing, artificial intelligence, economics, computational social science, digital humanities, policy, and ethics.

## Submission Types and Deadlines

*   **Abstracts due:** June 5, 2024
*   **Full papers due:** June 12, 2024
*   **Notifications:** July 31, 2024
*   **Conference Dates:** October 16–19, 2024

## Contribution Types

*   **Full Papers:** These are typically in-depth research contributions.
*   **Works-in-Progress (WIP):** For presenting ongoing research and preliminary results.

## Important Links

*   View the keynote speakers.
*   View the list of accepted papers: [Accepted Papers](/papers.html).
*   View the list of workshops.
*   View the Works-in-Progress: [Works-in-Progress](/papers.html#wip).

## Community Engagement

*   **Google Group (mailing list):** Join [crowd-hcomp Google Group](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/crowd-hcomp) to receive announcements. To subscribe, send an email to [crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com](crowd-hcomp+subscribe@googlegroups.com).
*   **Slack Community:** Join the [HCOMP Slack Community](https://hcomp.slack.com/) to connect with researchers, industry players, practitioners, and crowd workers.
*   **Twitter:** Follow us at [@hcomp_conf](https://twitter.com/hcomp_conf) and use the hashtag [#HCOMP2024](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23hcomp2024).

## Registration

Registration is now open. Please visit the href="RegistrationACHI25.html" - Registration Link

## Awards

The HCOMP Test of Time and Impact Award will be announced and given out this year. For more information, check the href="/program.html" - technical program .

## Co-located Event

HCOMP 2024 is colocated with ACM UIST 2024 (October 13-16, 2024).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - Health Informatics Conference (HIC 2026)

The International Conference on Health Informatics (HIC) 2026 is organized by INSTICC and is part of BIOSTEC, the 19th International Joint Conference on Biomedical Engineering Systems and Technologies. Registration for HIC allows free access to all other BIOSTEC conferences, which are held in conjunction with ICISSP 2026, ICPRAM 2026, and ROBOVIS 2026.

### Scope

The purpose of HIC is to bring together researchers and practitioners interested in the specification, design, development, and application of information and communication technologies (ICT) to healthcare and medicine in general, and to the support of persons with special needs in particular. Key technologies and research areas include big data, networking, graphical interfaces, data mining, machine learning, pattern recognition, and intelligent decision support systems. The conference addresses issues such as mobility and ubiquity in healthcare systems, physiological and behavioral modeling, standardization of health records, procedures, and technologies, certification, integration, scaling-up, privacy, and security.

## Conference Topics

*   Assistive Technologies
*   Home monitoring and Smart Homes
*   Telehealth
*   Human-Machine Interaction in Healthcare IT
*   Usability and UX of Healthcare IT
*   Integration and Scaling-up of Healthcare IT in Real Care Settings
*   eHealth
*   eHealth Applications
*   Electronic Health Records and Standards
*   Evaluation and Use of Healthcare IT
*   Healthcare Management Systems
*   Human-Machine Interfaces
*   ICT, Aging and Disability
*   Interoperability and Data Integration
*   Application of Health Informatics in Clinical Cases
*   Medical Informatics
*   Mobile Technologies for Healthcare Applications
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Physiological and Behavioral Modeling
*   Software Systems in Medicine
*   Cognitive Informatics
*   Wearable Health Informatics
*   Big Data in Healthcare
*   Wellbeing Informatics
*   Confidentiality and Data Security
*   Data Mining and Data Analysis
*   Data Visualization
*   Databases and Datawarehousing
*   Decision Support Systems
*   Design and Development of Methodologies for Healthcare IT
*   Medical Artificial Intelligence
*   Large Language Models in Medicine

## Keynote Speakers

HEALTHINF 2026 will feature several invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts in their areas. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Types:

*   **Complete Papers:** Can be submitted as a **Regular Paper** (completed and validated research) or a **Position Paper** (work in progress, arguable opinion, ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures, or results).
*   **Abstracts:** For presentation only, not published in proceedings.

### Submission Guidelines:

*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Papers should address one or several of the conference areas or topics.
*   Submissions must NOT include author's personal details, acknowledgments, or any reference that may disclose the authors' identity to facilitate **double-blind paper evaluation**.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.
*   All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS**.
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under [Guidelines and Templates](https://www.scitepress.org/CallforPapers.aspx).
*   Authors will receive an automatic confirmation email upon successful submission.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, with an ISBN reference, on paper and digital support.
*   Papers will be available at the [SCITEPRESS Digital Library](https://www.scitepress.org/PublishedPapers/2026).
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef, and each paper will be given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   A short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers is planned for publication with Springer in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** March 2 - 4, 2026 (AOE)

### Regular Papers

*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** December 19, 2025

### Workshops

### Demos

*Note: All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".*

## Secretariat

*   **Fax:** +351 265 520 186

callForPapers:
# HotNets 2025: Call for Papers

The Twenty-Fourth ACM Workshop on Hot Topics in Networks (HotNets 2025) will be held from **November 17-18, 2025**, in **College Park, Maryland, USA**.

## Overview

HotNets 2025 aims to bring together researchers in computer networks and systems for a lively debate on the theory and practice of networking. It provides a venue for discussing innovative ideas and debating future research agendas in the field.

## Submission Invitation

We invite researchers and practitioners to submit **short position papers**. Submissions are encouraged to identify fundamental open questions, advocate for new approaches, offer constructive critiques of the state of networking research, re-frame or debunk existing work, report unexpected early results from a deployment, present promising but unproven ideas, or propose new evaluation methods. Well-reasoned arguments or preliminary evaluations are considered sufficient support for the possibility of the paper's claims.

HotNets seeks interesting ideas over incremental, well-baked systems, favoring early work and papers likely to stimulate reflection and discussion.

## Topics of Interest

HotNets takes a broad view of networking research, including (but not limited to):

*   Mobile, wide-area, data-center, home, and enterprise networks.
*   Link technologies (wired, wireless, optical, visual, acoustic).
*   Social networks and network architecture.
*   Packet-processing and transmission hardware and software.
*   Virtualization, mobility, provisioning and resource management.
*   Performance, energy consumption, sustainability, topology, robustness.
*   Measurement, diagnosis, verification, privacy, security, economics and evolution.
*   Theory, usability, machine learning, and interactions with applications.

## Submission and Formatting Guidelines

*   **Submission Deadline:** **July 9, 2025** (23:59 AoE)
*   **Author Notification:** September 19, 2025
*   **Format:** Two-column ACM proceedings format.
*   **Length:** No more than **6 pages**, excluding references. References have no page limit, but appendices are not allowed.
*   **Content:** Papers must contain novel ideas and differ significantly in content from previously published papers.
*   **Anonymity:** All submissions must be blind (no author names or affiliations indicated).
*   **File Format:** Electronic submissions in PDF only.
*   **Language:** English.
*   **Template:** Use the provided LaTeX class file: [hotnets25-template.zip](https://hotnets.eecs.umich.edu/hotnets25/docs/hotnets25-template.zip). Ensure correct margins and settings as specified in the template.
    *   First two lines of the LaTeX document should be:
        ```latex
        \documentclass[sigconf, 10pt, anonymous, nonacm]{acmart}
        \settopmatter{printfolios=true, printccs=false, printacmref=false}
        ```
*   **Citations:** Numeric style (e.g., [52]).
*   **Submission Portal:** Submit papers on [HotCRP](https://hotnets25.hotcrp.com/).

## Policy on Concurrent Submissions

Concurrent submissions to HotNets 2025 and any other peer-reviewed venue covering the same work are prohibited. Authors with questions about this policy should contact the PC co-chairs before submitting.

## Ethical Concerns

Authors must attest that their work complies with all applicable ethical standards. The PC may have its own discussion of the ethics of the work and authors agree to be available to respond to queries from the PC chairs.

## Workshop Participation

Attendance is limited to approximately 90 people in person to facilitate discussion. In-person invitations will be allocated first to authors of accepted papers, organizers, committee members, and sponsors. Paper presentations must be in-person. A limited number of open registration slots will be available.

## Sponsorship

Sponsored by ACM SIGCOMM.

callForPapers:
# Call For Papers

The 32nd IEEE International Symposium on High-Performance Computer Architecture (HPCA) will be held in **Sydney, Australia in 2026**, from **January 31 – February 4, 2026**.

HPCA is a high-impact premier venue for presenting research results on a wide range of Computer Architecture topics.

## Topics of Interest

*   Processor, memory, and storage systems architecture and microarchitecture
*   Interconnection networks and network interface architecture
*   Domain-specific architectures and accelerators
*   FPGA, CGRA, and reconfigurable systems
*   Near-/in-memory computing
*   Cloud, datacenter, cluster/distributed computer systems
*   Compilers/OS/runtimes as they relate to Computer Architecture
*   IoT, mobile, edge, and embedded architectures
*   Effects of circuits or technology on architecture (3D/chiplets/interposer/wafer-scale)
*   Architecture modeling and simulation methodologies
*   Architectures using quantum, superconducting, and emerging technologies
*   Reliability/fault tolerance as they relate to Computer Architecture
*   Security and privacy as they relate to Computer Architecture
*   Evaluation and measurement of real computing systems
*   Verification, testing, and correctness as they relate to Computer Architecture
*   Power and energy as they relate to Computer Architecture
*   Sustainable computing as they relate to Computer Architecture

We encourage authors to contact the program chairs (Aamer Jaleel and Mattan Erez) if they have a question regarding topic fit.

## Industry Track

HPCA 2026 features a separate Industry Track with a separate call for papers. The goal of the HPCA Industry Track is to publish papers that are written by industry authors and their content relates to industrial products/processes.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** July 25, 2025 23:59 UTC / 19:59 EDT
*   **Paper Submission:** August 1, 2025 23:59 UTC / 19:59 EDT
*   **Revision/Rebuttal Period:** October 7 – 20, 2025
*   **Notification:** November 7, 2025
*   **Final Papers Due:** December 4, 2025

## Submission Guidelines & Policies

All paper submissions must adhere to several important aspects:

### Final Submission Mindset

Submitting papers for review that are not yet complete and polished abuses the review process and is disrespectful to the Program Committee and the Computer Architecture community. All authors must affirm that their submission is, to the best of their abilities, complete, polished, and ready for comprehensive review. Furthermore, if all reviewers of a submission find that the submission is lacking in this regard, detailed reviewer feedback will be withheld from the authors. In other words, there is a cost to submitting unfinished work – it may “poison” future reviews without the authors gaining any feedback.

### Reviewer Continuity Initiative

HPCA 2026 is considering an initiative to maintain reviewer continuity for submitted papers that were rejected from MICRO 2025 on an opt-in basis. The goal for this initiative is to improve the fairness of the overall review process in Computer Architecture. It is in the best interest of authors and the community to have papers undergo a consistent revision process. However, please do not feel pressured to participate in this initiative, reviewers will not be made aware of your choice implicitly or explicitly.

If all authors of a submission opt in to the “reviewer continuity initiative”, reviewers who had previously reviewed a version of the submission for MICRO 2025 may be explicitly assigned to review the submission (PC members also must opt in to this initiative). If the authors do not opt in for “reviewer continuity”, reviewers of previous submissions may still be assigned to review the submitted version of the paper based on reviewer expertise, reviewer load balance, and other similar agnostic criteria.

### Revision Letters

If a submission has been previously reviewed and rejected from another venue or conference and is now being submitted to HPCA 2026, the authors must provide a letter explaining how the paper has been revised for this current submission, regardless of whether the authors opt to participate in “reviewer continuity” or not. Authors may choose to only permit the PC Chairs to have access and knowledge of this letter. Authors who opt in for reviewer continuity implicitly make their revision letter available to reviewers who reviewed a prior version for MICRO 2025. Note that it is not a requirement that papers be revised before being submitted to HPCA, but we expect a revision letter nonetheless.

### Abstract Registration and Final Submission

Authors must register an abstract one week before the paper submission deadline. The purpose is to ensure that authors are fully aware of all submission requirements, topic selection, conflict of interest registration, etc. All information regarding the submission may be edited up to final submission time but may not change once the review process has started. In particular, authorship at submission time must match that of the final publication, if accepted.

### Formatting and Submission Instructions

Detailed formatting and submission instructions will be made available on the submission site ([http://hpca2026.hotcrp.com](http://hpca2026.hotcrp.com)) at a later date.

# IEEE HPCC 2025: Call for Papers

The 27th IEEE International Conference on High Performance Computing and Communications (HPCC-2025) will be held from **August 13-15, 2025**, in **Exeter, England, UK**.

IEEE HPCC-2025 is sponsored by **IEEE**, **IEEE Computer Society**, and **IEEE Technical Committee on Scalable Computing (TCSC)**.

## Scope and Topics

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

### Track 1: High Performance Computing and Applications

*   High Performance Computing Theory
*   High Performance Computing Architectures
*   System Software and Middleware
*   System Software Support for Scientific Workflows
*   Storage and I/O Systems
*   Resource Management
*   Instruction-Level and Thread-Level Parallelism
*   Performance Modeling and Evaluation
*   Massively Multicore Systems
*   Future Novel Computing Platforms
*   Database Applications and Data Mining
*   High Performance Computing for Bioinformatics
*   High Performance Computing for Big Data
*   High Performance Computing for AI
*   High Performance Computing for Block Chains
*   Green High Performance Computing

### Track 2: Parallel and Distributed Computing and Systems

*   Parallel and Distributed System Architectures
*   Parallel and Distributed Algorithms
*   Data Center Architectures
*   Resource Virtualization
*   Web Services and Internet Computing
*   Cloud Computing
*   Grid and Cluster Computing
*   Federated Learning
*   Embedded Systems
*   Distributed Systems and Applications
*   Pervasive/Ubiquitous Computing & Intelligence
*   Distributed Graphics and VR/AR/MR Systems
*   Distributed AI and Soft/Natural Computing
*   Power-Efficient and Green Computing Systems
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for Big Data
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing for AI

### Track 3: Communications and Networking

*   Network and Interconnect Architectures
*   Computer Networks
*   Internet Architectures and Protocols
*   Telecommunications
*   Trust, Security, and Privacy
*   Energy-Aware Computing and Networking
*   5G Network
*   Software Defined Networking
*   Network Functions Virtualization
*   Machine Learning and Deep Learning
*   Social Networking and Computing
*   Performance Evaluation and Measurement

### Track 4: Computing Power Network(CPN) and Network for AI Computing

*   Computing and network convergence technology for AI application
*   Resource allocation and collaboration in CPN
*   Computing power identification and measurement technology
*   Lossless network design
*   Technology for RDMA
*   IPv6/SRv6-based hyperscale AI Datacenter

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal:** 1 March 2025
*   **Submission Deadline:** 18 May 2025 (Firm Deadline)
*   **Authors Notification:** 15 June 2025
*   **Final Manuscript Due:** 15 July 2025
*   **Registration Due:** 15 July 2025

## Submission and Publication

Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers to HPCC-2025. Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore** subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements.

The authors of selected best papers will be invited post conference to extend their contributions for **special issues of prestigious journals** to be planned in conjunction with the conference.
