callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

Welcome to the 2025 ACM SIGPLAN International Symposium on Memory Management (ISMM 2025)! ISMM is the premier forum dedicated to research in memory management, covering a broad range of topics including memory performance, allocator design, garbage collection, architectural support for memory management, persistent memories, emerging memory technologies, and more. ISMM 2025 aims to encourage submissions and participation from related fields such as computer architecture and computer systems, in addition to the core PL community.

Update: Submissions are now due **2025-03-18 (AoE UTC-12h)**.

## Submission Types

ISMM 2025 is soliciting full-length submissions covering new work on all memory management related topics in both software and hardware (and their cooperation), as well as papers presenting confirmations or refutations of important prior results. In addition to regular papers, ISMM also invites submissions of the following kinds:

*   **Surveys and comparative analyses** that shed new light on previously published techniques.
*   **Practitioner reports**, describing experience with memory management in production. Such papers are not expected to provide novel research contributions, but they should not have been previously published.
*   **Intellectual abstracts**, where researchers share designs, algorithms, or theory that may be interesting to the memory management community, but not yet evaluated.

Please indicate the submission type using a subtitle, e.g., `\subtitle{This submission is a regular paper}`.

## Co-location

ISMM 2025 will be held in-person as part of PLDI 2025, sharing the venue and activities.

## Areas of Interest

Areas of interest include but are not limited to:

*   Garbage collection algorithms and implementations
*   Memory allocation and de-allocation
*   Memory system design and analysis (both software and hardware)
*   Hardware support for memory management
*   Memory management for large-scale data-intensive systems
*   Memory management at datacenter and cloud scales
*   Formal analysis and verification of memory management algorithms
*   Compiler analyses to aid memory management
*   Tools to analyze memory usage and characteristics of programs
*   Empirical analysis of memory intensive programs
*   Formal analysis and verification of memory intensive programs
*   Memory management for machine learning systems
*   Programming and management of emerging or persistent memories
*   Caches, memory controllers, memory hierarchies and their management
*   Cache coherence and memory consistency
*   Processing in memory (including processing near and using memory)
*   Memory technology and architecture (SRAM, DRAM, flash, NVM, emerging technologies)
*   Security and privacy of memory systems
*   Robustness of memory systems
*   Low-latency and low-energy memory systems

## Industry Participation

The symposium welcomes industry practitioners presenting their recent practice and findings in memory management related to real-world deployments.

## Submission Link

Submissions should be made via the hotcrp system: [https://ismm25.hotcrp.com](https://ismm25.hotcrp.com)

## Formatting Instructions

*   All papers must be submitted on-line in **Portable Document Format (PDF)**.
*   Papers should be formatted according to the **two-column ACM proceedings format**.
*   Each paper should have **no more than 12 pages**, excluding bibliography.
*   Font size should be **10pt**.
*   There is no limit on the page count for references.
*   Each reference must list all authors (do not use et al).
*   Citations should be in **numeric style**, e.g., `[52]`.
*   Submissions must be printable on US Letter and A4 sized paper.
*   Ensure figures and tables are legible, even when printed in grayscale.
*   Appendices should be submitted as supplementary material and must also be anonymized.
*   Use the `sigplan` subformat of the `acmart` format. The first two lines of the LaTeX document should be:
    ```latex
    \documentclass[sigplan,10pt,review,anonymous]{acmart}
    \settopmatter{printfolios=true,printccs=false,printacmref=false}
    ```

Papers that exceed the length requirement or deviate from the expected format will be rejected.

## Double-Blind Reviewing

ISMM uses double-blind reviewing. This means that author names and affiliations must be omitted from the submission. Additionally, references to prior work done by the authors should be made in the third person. Any supplementary material must also be anonymized. If you have doubts, please contact the Program Chairs.

## Declaring Conflicts

When submitting, you must declare potential conflicts, including adviser-advisee, institutional, financial, and recent co-authorship (last 2 years). Avoid spurious conflicts, as they can be grounds for rejection. Consult the Program Chair if unsure.

## Author Response

The author response process will occur in **April 2025**, providing an opportunity to respond to factual errors in reviews before final decisions are made.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Paper submission:** Tue 18 Mar 2025
*   **Author response period:** Wed 23 - Fri 25 Apr 2025
*   **Author notification:** Sat 3 May 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers due:** Thu 15 May 2025
*   **Conference day:** Tue 17 Jun 2025

# ISWC 2025: Call for Papers

The 24th International Semantic Web Conference (ISWC 2025) will be held in **Nara, Japan**, at the **Nara Prefectural Convention Center**, from **November 2-6, 2025**.

ISWC 2025 will be an **in-person conference**. The Semantic Web Association (SWSA) is offsetting the carbon footprint of ISWC 2025 as part of its sustainability initiative.

## Important Dates

**Workshop proposals:** February 18, 2025
**Semantic Web Challenge proposals:** March 4, 2025
**Workshop notifications:** March 11, 2025

This joint conference, co-located with the European Conference on Computational Biology (ECCB), is the world's largest bioinformatics and computational biology event, focusing on the development and application of advanced computational methods to address biological problems.
callForPapers:
# ISMB/ECCB 2025: Call for Submissions

The 33rd annual International Conference on Intelligent Systems for Molecular Biology (ISMB), in conjunction with the 24th Annual Conference of the European Conference on Computational Biology (ECCB), will be the year's most important computational biology event. This international meeting will be held **in-person at the ACC Liverpool, UK**, and **virtually through ISCB's Nucleus platform**.

## About the Conference

ISMB/ECCB 2025 focuses on the development and application of advanced computational methods to address biological problems. It brings together researchers from computer science, bioinformatics, computational biology, molecular biology, mathematics, statistics, and related fields, providing a multidisciplinary platform for sharing the latest advancements and fostering new dialogues. The conference actively involves ISCB’s Communities of Special Interest (COSIs) in program development.

## Submission Types

We invite submissions for the following formats:

*   **Abstracts:** For talks and posters.
*   **Proceedings:** For scientific papers.
*   **Tech Track:** Proposals for technological advancements and applications.
*   **Tutorials:** Proposals for educational sessions.
*   **Late-breaking posters:** For recent developments.

## Topics of Interest

The conference covers a wide range of areas within computational biology and bioinformatics. The scientific program features numerous specialized tracks, including but not limited to:

*   AI-powered computational biology
*   Bioinformatics in the UK
*   BioVis (Biological Visualization)
*   DREAM Challenges
*   Machine Learning for Computational Systems Biology (MLCSB)
*   Microbiome analysis
*   NIH Track on GenAI, Cyberinfrastructure, Digital Twins, and Quantum Computing
*   Student Council Symposium
*   Text Mining in biology
*   Web 2025 applications

## Important Dates

### Abstracts (for Talks and Posters)

*   **Call for abstracts opens:** Monday, January 20, 2025
*   **Abstracts submission deadline:** Thursday, April 17, 2025 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Late-breaking poster submissions open:** Monday, April 21, 2025
*   **Late-breaking poster submissions deadline:** Thursday, May 15, 2025 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Abstract acceptance notifications sent:** Tuesday, May 13, 2025
*   **Late-breaking poster notifications sent:** Thursday, May 22, 2025
*   **Presenter registration deadline (for talks and/or posters):** Friday, June 13, 2025

### Proceedings

*   **Call for proceedings opens:** Thursday, December 5, 2024
*   **Proceedings submission deadline:** Thursday, January 23, 2025 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Conditional acceptance notifications sent:** Thursday, March 13, 2025
*   **Revised papers deadline:** Thursday, March 27, 2025 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Final acceptance notifications sent:** Tuesday, April 8, 2025
*   **Publication fees due for accepted papers:** Thursday, May 1, 2025

### Tech Track

*   **Call for tech track opens:** Wednesday, January 1, 2025
*   **Tech track proposals deadline:** Thursday, May 1, 2025 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Tech track acceptance notifications sent:** Tuesday, May 20, 2025
*   **Tech track payments due:** Tuesday, June 10, 2025

### Tutorials

*   **Call for tutorials opens:** Monday, November 4, 2024
*   **Tutorial proposals deadline:** Thursday, December 19, 2024 (AoE) *no extensions*
*   **Tutorial acceptance notifications sent:** Tuesday, January 28, 2025
*   **Draft tutorial materials due for review:** Thursday, June 5, 2025
*   **Final tutorial materials due for posting:** Wednesday, June 25, 2025
*   **Last day for tutorial registration:** Thursday, July 10, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions are accepted for **in-person** and **virtual** participation.
*   Only `.pdf` or `.doc` files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   Final author manuscripts for proceedings are limited to **6 pages**, with a maximum of **4 extra pages** allowed at an additional cost.
*   LaTeX templates are available (please refer to the conference website for details).
*   All submission deadlines are strictly enforced, with **no extensions** granted.
*   Submissions must be made through the respective sections on the conference website (e.g., Abstracts, Proceedings, Tech Track, Tutorials).

## Presentation Options

*   **In-person participants:** Will have access to training workshops, tutorials, the Student Council Symposium, over 500 scientific talks, exclusive networking events, and an on-demand repository of talks and poster presentations.
*   **Virtual participants:** Will have livestream and on-demand access to sessions and tutorials, a live question and answer feature, live chat features within virtual session rooms, and access to the on-demand repository.

## Organizing Committees

*   **Conference Chairs:** Information available on the conference website.
*   **Proceedings External Reviewers:** Information available on the conference website.

## Sponsors and Partners

Information on exhibitors and sponsors is available on the conference website.

summary: The 22nd International Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR 2025) will be held in Melbourne, Australia, from November 11-17, 2025. KR is a leading forum for research in Artificial Intelligence that focuses on the explicit declarative representation of knowledge and its computational management. KR 2025 will include several tracks, workshops, tutorials, a doctoral consortium, and award nominations.
callForPapers:
# KR 2025: Call for Papers - Main Track

The 22nd International Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR 2025) will be held from **November 11-17, 2025, in Melbourne, Australia**. The conference is co-located with CPAIOR 2025, ICAPS 2025, and NMR 2025.

## About KR

Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR) is a well-established and vibrant field of research within Artificial Intelligence. KR builds on the fundamental thesis that knowledge can often be represented in an explicit declarative form, suitable for processing by dedicated symbolic reasoning engines. KR has contributed to various areas of AI and beyond.

## Call for Papers: Main Track

We solicit papers presenting novel results on the principles of KR, which clearly contribute to the formal foundations of the field or show the applicability of KR techniques to implemented or implementable systems. We welcome papers from other areas that demonstrate clear use of, or contributions to, the principles or practice of KR. We also encourage "reports from the field" of applications, experiments, developments, and tests.

## Submission Guidelines for the Main Track

*   Submissions should be **anonymous** and will be subject to **double-blind peer review**.
*   Authors are encouraged to share and discuss their work as usual, including posting drafts online (e.g., on ArXiv).
*   Contributions may be **regular papers** (up to 9 pages) or **short papers** (up to 4 pages), including abstract, figures, and appendices (if any) but excluding references and acknowledgements.
*   Papers must be written in English and formatted using the [provided style files](files/KR25_authors_kit.zip).
*   The PDF file should be submitted through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=kr2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=kr2025).
*   Authors of papers may submit a separate PDF or ZIP file with additional information supporting their claims (such as proof details, additional experimental results, further details on experimental design, etc).

## Important Dates (Main Track)

All deadlines are AoE - Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12).

*   **Submission of title and abstract:** May 7, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** May 12, 2025
*   **Author response period:** June 25 - July 1, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 10, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** August 15, 2025

## Publication

Accepted papers will be published in the KR 2025 proceedings. At least one author of each accepted paper is required to participate in the conference and present the work.

Top papers from KR 2025 will be invited to the award-winning paper tracks of Artificial Intelligence (AIJ) and the Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research (JAIR).

## Other Calls

KR 2025 will also include:

*   [KR in the Wild Track](call_kr_in_the_wild.html)
*   [KR&R in Planning & Scheduling Track](call_krr_in_ps.html)
*   [KR and Constraints Track](call_kr_and_constraints.html)
*   [Tutorial and Workshop Proposals](call_tutorial_and_workshop.html)
*   [Nominations: KR Early Career Award](call_eca_award.html)
*   [Nominations: KR Test of Time Award](call_tot_award.html)
*   [Nominations: KR Distinguished Service Award](call_dsa_award.html)
*   [Doctoral Consortium Applications](call_doctoral_consortium.html)
*   [Video Track](call_video_track.html)
*   [Recently Published Research Track](call_recently_published.html)

callForPapers:
# RTCSA 2025: Call for Papers

The 31st IEEE International Conference on Embedded and Real-Time Computing Systems and Applications (RTCSA 2025) will be held in **Singapore** from **August 20-22, 2025**. RTCSA 2025 is co-located with NVMSA 2025.

Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore, subject to meeting IEEE Xplore's scope and quality requirements.

## Important Dates (Main Conference)

(All times are UTC-12, or "anywhere on earth", unless otherwise stated.)

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** April 5, 2025 (previously March 28, 2025)
*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** April 5, 2025 (previously March 31, 2025)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** May 7, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** June 5, 2025

## Important Dates (Posters and Demos Session)

*   **Submission Deadline:** June 19, 2025 AoE
*   **Acceptance Notification:** July 4, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** July 11, 2025

## Topics of Interest

The conference seeks papers that describe original research in the following areas, but not limited to:

### REAL-TIME SYSTEMS TRACK

*   Real-Time scheduling
*   Timing analysis
*   Workload models for real-time systems
*   Temperature/Energy-aware scheduling
*   Scheduling and resource management in heterogeneous architectures
*   Scheduling over distributed architectures
*   Formal methods for temporal guarantees
*   Programming languages and run-time systems
*   Analyzing, understanding, and improving timing predictability of middlewares (ROS, Ray, Kubernete, …)
*   Communication networks and protocols for real-time systems
*   Time-sensitive media processing and transmissions
*   Latency and throughput in real-time databases
*   Real-time machine learning
*   Learning-enabled real-time systems
*   Learning-assisted real-time systems

### IoT, CPS, AND EMERGING APPLICATIONS TRACK

*   Systems, technology and foundations of IoT and CPS
*   Applications and case studies of IoT and CPS
*   Smart and connected health
*   Industrial internet and industry 4.0
*   Smart city technology and applications
*   Smart transportation and infrastructure
*   Cyber-physical co-design
*   Cloud, middleware and networks for IoT and CPS
*   Wireless sensor-actuator networks for IoT and CPS
*   Low-Power Wide-Area Network (LPWAN) for IoT
*   Emerging IoT protocols and network abstractions including 5G/6G
*   Medical CPS
*   CPS software/system engineering

### EMBEDDED SYSTEMS TRACK

*   Multi-core embedded systems
*   Operating systems
*   Compiler and embedded software
*   Embedded system design tools and methodologies
*   Non-volatile memory and storage
*   Power/Thermal aware design
*   Fault tolerance, reliability and security
*   Sensor-based systems and applications
*   Embedded Systems for Machine-Learning
*   Reconfigurable computing architectures and software support
*   Ubiquitous and distributed embedded systems and networks

## New at RTCSA'25: Industry Session

RTCSA 2025 introduces a dedicated Industry Session, providing a platform for contributions that focus on industrial applications and practices. Submissions to this session will follow the same single-blind review process as regular papers, with the following additional criteria:

*   A paper is eligible for the Industry Session if:
    *   It describes industrial applications and/or practices;
    *   At least one co-author has an industrial affiliation.

Submissions to the Industry Session will be evaluated primarily on their practical significance.

## Submission Guidelines

Both research and industry papers are solicited. The submitted manuscript must describe original work not previously published and not concurrently submitted elsewhere. Abstract submission is a prerequisite for full paper submission.

We welcome high quality papers, adhering to the following two formats:

*   **Full Paper format:** technical content must fit within **10 pages**; references and acknowledgments can be arranged in 2 additional pages.
*   **Short Paper format:** technical content must fit within **6 pages**; references and acknowledgements can be arranged in 2 additional pages.

Both types of submission must be formatted according to the **IEEE conference proceedings format (two-columns, single-space, 10pt)**. Submitted papers are subject to single-blind reviews.

In some cases, the Program Committee may decide to accept a full paper submission as a short paper, in which case, the authors will be required to reduce its length for the final version.

By submitting a paper, authors implicitly agree that at least one author will register at the full registration rate to the conference and present the paper in person. RTCSA 2025 reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution after the conference (e.g., removal from the digital library and indexing services), if the paper is not presented at the conference.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore. Selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to the **Springer Real-Time Systems journal**.

## Organizing Team

*   **General chairs:** Rui Tan (Nanyang Technological University, Singapore), Xue (Steve) Liu (McGill University, Canada)
*   **Program chairs:** Mitra Nasri (Real-Time Systems Track), Abusayeed Saifullah (IoT, CPS, and emerging applications Track), Wei Zhang (Embedded Systems Track)

summary: The IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering (SANER) is the premier event focusing on the theory and practice of recovering information from existing software and systems, exploring innovative methods for system renewal and program understanding. SANER 2025 will be held from March 4-7, 2025, in Montréal, Québec, Canada, at Polytechnique Montréal.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: SANER 2025

The 32nd IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution, and Reengineering (SANER 2025) invites high-quality submissions of papers describing original and unpublished research results. SANER 2025 will be held from **March 04-07, 2025**, at **Polytechnique Montréal in Montreal, Canada**.

The conference promotes discussion and interaction among researchers and practitioners about the development of maintainable systems, and the improvement, evolution, migration, and reengineering of existing systems. SANER will feature technical research paper sessions, workshops, an early research achievements track, an industry paper track, a tool demonstration track, and a dedicated track on negative results in software analysis, evolution, and reengineering.

## Topics of Interest

Submissions should be of direct interest to the software analysis, evolution, and reengineering community. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   AI for Software Engineering
*   Software Engineering for AI
*   Generative AI and LLM
*   Software Tools for Software Evolution and Maintenance
*   Software Analysis, Parsing, and Fact Extraction
*   Software Reverse Engineering and Reengineering
*   Program Comprehension
*   Software Evolution Analysis
*   Software Architecture Recovery and Reverse Architecting
*   Program Transformation and Refactoring
*   Mining Software Repositories and Software Analytics
*   Software Visualization
*   Software Reconstruction and Migration
*   Software Maintenance and Evolution
*   Program Repair
*   Software Release Engineering, Continuous Integration, and Delivery
*   Empirical Studies on all the above topics
*   Education related to all of the above topics
*   Legal Aspects

We encourage submissions on collaborations between industry and academia, case studies, as well as experience reports relevant to the conference themes. Secondary studies synthesizing findings on these topics are also welcome, provided they offer a comprehensive synthesis.

## Submission Instructions

All submitted papers will undergo a rigorous peer review process and will be selected based on originality, quality, soundness, and relevance. Submissions must be original, not published, accepted, or under review elsewhere. All submissions must be in PDF format and conform to the IEEE Conference Proceedings Formatting Guidelines.

*   **Research Track:** Submissions should not exceed 12 pages (with the last 2 pages reserved for references only).
*   **Industrial Papers:** Submissions should not exceed 12 pages (with the last 2 pages reserved for references only) for full papers; talk proposals should not exceed 2 pages.
*   **Short Papers and Posters:** Submissions should not exceed 5 pages (including all text, figures, references, and appendices).
*   **Early Research Achievement (ERA) Track:** Submissions should not exceed 5 pages (including all text, figures, references, and appendices).
*   **Reproducibility Studies and Negative Results (RENE) Track:** Submissions should not exceed 4 pages for appendices to conference submissions or previous work and should not exceed 10 pages for new reproducibility studies and new descriptions of negative results.
*   **Tool Demo Track:** Submissions should not exceed 5 pages.
*   **Journal-First Papers Track:** Submissions should not exceed 1 page.
*   **Registered Report Track:** Submissions should not exceed 7 pages (with the last 1 page reserved for references only).

**Important Note:** Research, Short Papers, and Poster Tracks follow a full double-anonymous review process.

## Special Issue

Authors of selected research papers accepted at SANER 2025 will be invited to submit revised, extended versions of their manuscripts for a special issue featured by Springer’s Empirical Software Engineering Journal (EMSE). The best papers from the conference will be awarded.

## Important Dates

(All deadlines are "Anywhere on Earth" time)

### Research Track

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** October 4, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** October 11, 2024
*   **Notifications:** November 29, 2024

### Industrial Track

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** November 1, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** November 8, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 18, 2024

### Short Papers and Posters Track

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** November 4, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** November 11, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 11, 2024

### Early Research Achievement (ERA) Track

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** November 4, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** November 11, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 11, 2024

### Reproducibility Studies and Negative Results (RENE) Track

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** November 1, 2024
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** November 8, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 15, 2024

### Tool Demo Track

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** November 11, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 13, 2024

### Journal-First Track

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** December 3, 2024
*   **Notifications:** December 17, 2024

### Registered Report Track

*   **Submission Deadline:** November 6, 2024
*   **First Notification (Reviews):** December 6, 2024
*   **Second Round Submission (Rebuttal & Revised Report):** December 20, 2024
*   **Final Notification (Stage 1):** January 10, 2025
*   **Accepted Report to arXiv Submission:** January 17, 2025

## Organizing Committee

**General Chairs:**
*   Mohammad Hamdaqa, Polytechnique Montréal, Canada
*   Foutse Khomh, Polytechnique Montréal, Canada

**Program Chairs:**
*   Masud Rahman, Dalhousie University, Canada
*   Maria Teresa Baldassarre, University of Bari, Italy

## Submission Links

*   [EasyChair Submission Link](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=saner2025)
*   [Conference Website](https://conf.researchr.org/home/saner-2025)

summary: The IEEE International Conference on Visual Communications and Image Processing (VCIP 2025) will be held in Klagenfurt, Austria, from December 1-4, 2025. As a flagship conference and the oldest in its field, VCIP 2025 focuses on "Sustainable and Trustworthy Visual Communications in the Age of AI," providing a premier forum for research in visual communications and image processing.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 2025 edition of the Visual Communications and Image Processing (VCIP 2025) Conference, will be held in **Klagenfurt, Austria, during December 1-4, 2025**.

VCIP is the oldest conference in the field and one of the flagship conferences of the CAS Visual Signal Processing and Communications Technical Committee. Since 1986, VCIP has served as a premier forum for the exchange of fundamental and applied research in the field of visual communications and image processing.

### Theme

**Sustainable and Trustworthy Visual Communications in the Age of AI**

In the Age of AI, the rapid evolution of visual technologies presents both incredible opportunities and pressing challenges for communication. Sustainable and trustworthy visual communications have become critical, as we navigate a world increasingly dominated by generative AI, deepfakes, and synthetic media. As AI systems grow more capable of creating hyper-realistic images and videos, the need for transparency, ethical standards, and responsible design has never been greater.

### About VCIP 2025

VCIP 2025 will cover new technology frontiers and new use cases, in the visual signal processing and communication areas, to discuss and envision the future of both technology and applications. VCIP 2025 inherits the tradition of previous conferences in providing a fertile ground for researchers, engineers, and professionals from academia and industry around the world. The program will feature lecture, poster, and plenary sessions, as well as special sessions, demo sessions, and tutorials.

### Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   **Modalities:**
    *   Conventional image and video
    *   Stereoscopic, multi-view, and 360-degree image and video
    *   Light fields, point clouds, meshes, and holography
    *   Multi-spectral and hyper-spectral imaging
    *   NeRF and Gaussian splatting-based scene representation

*   **Visual Processing and Communication (conventional & AI-based):**
    *   Sensing, acquisition, representation, modeling, and registration
    *   Restoration, denoising, and enhancement
    *   Detection, recognition, understanding, retrieval, and classification
    *   Computational vision modeling and processing
    *   Perceptual-based processing
    *   Synthesis, rendering, and visualization
    *   Source coding and transmission, including standards
    *   Compressed domain processing
    *   Adaptive and low-latency streaming
    *   Edge, network and cloud-based coding
    *   Distributed visual information processing

*   **Applications, Services, Architectures, and Systems:**
    *   Biometrics, forensics, trust, and security
    *   Content provenance and authenticity
    *   Encryption and data hiding for secure visual communications
    *   Augmented and virtual reality
    *   Personal communications and social networks
    *   Gaming and broadcasting
    *   Drones and autonomous vehicles
    *   Mobile and wireless visual applications and systems
    *   Cloud-based and distributed architectures, services and systems
    *   Internet of Things
    *   Sustainability and green systems
    *   Multimodal user interfaces and interaction models
    *   Human Computer Interfaces
    *   Emerging applications, services, architectures and systems

*   **Performance Assessment:**
    *   Subjective and objective quality assessment methodologies
    *   Multimodal quality assessment
    *   Quality of experience, notably for real-time and streaming applications
    *   Task-based performance assessment
    *   Visual quality of life
    *   Complexity, delay and error resilience assessment
    *   Emerging performance assessment methods

### Important Dates

1.  **Grand Challenge Proposal Submission Deadline:** April 1, 2025
2.  **Grand Challenge Proposal Acceptance Notification:** April 15, 2025
3.  **Submission of Special Session and Tutorial Proposals:** May 1, 2025
4.  **Acceptance Notification of Special Sessions and Tutorials:** May 15, 2025
5.  **Call for Rising Star Nominations:** July 10, 2025
6.  **Paper Submission Deadline (Extended):** July 21, 2025
7.  **Grand Challenge Submission Deadline (Extended):** July 21, 2025
8.  **Demos, Open Source, and Datasets Submission Deadline (Extended):** July 21, 2025
9.  **Appointment of the Rising Star Selection Committee:** July 31, 2025
10. **Deadline for Nominations Submission:** August 30, 2025
11. **Paper Acceptance Notification (Extended):** September 22, 2025
12. **Selection of Rising Star Candidates:** September 30, 2025
13. **Invitation to the Rising Star Award Selected Candidates:** October 1, 2025
14. **Submission of Camera-Ready Papers:** October 15, 2025

### Submission Format

The format for submissions is **PDF**. High-quality papers will be recommended to Transaction CSVT for journal extension. You can find more details and submit your contribution via [https://vcip2025.itec.aau.at/paper-submissions/](https://vcip2025.itec.aau.at/paper-submissions/).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - VTC2026-Spring Nice

VTC2026-Spring in Nice will feature world-class technical sessions, workshops, and tutorials on, but not limited to, the following technical tracks. Prospective authors are invited to submit **5-page**, original, and unpublished full papers. A full paper can be up to 7 pages in length, just note that papers longer than 5 pages will require the purchase of additional page charges at the time of registration and final paper submission. Please do not submit papers longer than 8 pages for review as it is not likely that the paper could be edited to a maximum of 7 pages or less upon acceptance.

## Technical Tracks

1.  **5G, 6G, and Beyond**
2.  **Connected Vehicles, IoV, and V2X**
3.  **IoT, M2M, Sensor Networks, and Ad-Hoc Networking**
4.  **Space, Non-Terrestrial, Airborne, and Maritime Mobile Systems and Services**
5.  **Spectrum Management, Radio Access Technology, Services and Security**
6.  **Open, Virtual, and Interoperable Networks and Services**
7.  **Vehicle Cooperation and Control, Assisted, and Autonomous Driving**
8.  **Electric Vehicles, Vehicular Electronics, and Intelligent Transportation**
9.  **AI/Machine Learning for Communications**
10. **Multiple Antennas, MIMO, and Cooperative Communication**
11. **Antenna Systems, Propagation, and RF Design**
12. **Integrated Sensing, Communications, Positioning and Navigation**
13. **Signal Processing for Wireless Communications**
14. **Vehicular and Wireless Testbeds and Proof-of-Concepts**

## Important Dates

*   **Papers Submission Deadline:** December 10, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** February 28, 2026
*   **Final Regular Paper Submission:** TBD
*   **Author Registration:** TBD
*   **Early Bird Registration Ends:** TBD
*   **Regular Registration Due:** TBD

## Submission Requirements

*   **Paper Length:** 5-page paper (without overlength charge). Up to 2 additional pages are allowed with the purchase of additional page charges in the amount of **$100 USD** per additional page at the time of registration and final paper submission.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

Welcome to WiMob 2025!

The **21st International Conference on Wireless and Mobile Computing, Networking and Communications (WiMob 2025)** will be held in **Marrakech, Morocco**, from **October 20 - 22, 2025**. WiMob serves as an international forum for exchanging knowledge and experience among researchers, developers, and practitioners in wireless and mobile technology. This year's conference will focus on **5G, IoT, Cyber Security, and the use of Artificial Intelligence for mobile and wireless Networks**.

## Symposia and Topics of Interest

WiMob 2025 will host FIVE parallel symposia covering a wide range of topics:

*   **Wireless Communications (WC)**
    *   Broadband Wireless Communication Systems
    *   Multimedia Communications over Wireless
    *   Advances in Satellite Communication
    *   Modulation and Coding
    *   Multiple Access Techniques
    *   Channel Measurement and Characterization
    *   Location Estimation and Tracking
    *   MIMO Channels
    *   Multirate and Multicarrier Communications
    *   Cognitive and Cooperative MAC
    *   Heterogeneous Cellular Networks
    *   Energy Harvesting Communication Systems
    *   Large Scale Massive MIMO Systems
    *   Reconfigurable Intelligent Surface

*   **Next Generation Mobile Networking (NGMN)**
    *   Next Generation Mobile Networking
    *   5G Wireless and Mobile Networks
    *   6G Wireless and Mobile Networks
    *   Cellular Systems, PCS Modeling and Configuration
    *   Wireless Sensor Networks
    *   Cross-layer Design and Optimization
    *   Congestion and Admission Control
    *   Mobility patterns, Location and Handoff Management
    *   Design and Analysis of Wireless LAN/WAN
    *   Wireless multicasting, broadcasting and geocasting
    *   Wireless Sensors and Actuators/Robots Networks
    *   Energy-efficient Protocols for Wireless Networks
    *   Opportunistic Networks
    *   Vehicular Wireless Networks
    *   Wireless Mesh Networks
    *   Delay Tolerant Networks
    *   Integration of Ad hoc Networks with Wireless Access Networks
    *   QoS Support for Mobile Networks
    *   RFID Networks and Protocols
    *   WPAN, LOWPAN
    *   Optimization Models and Algorithms
    *   Portable Devices and Wearable Computers
    *   Virtualization in Wireless Networks
    *   Software defined Wireless Networks
    *   Swarms of Unmanned Vehicles
    *   Space Networks
    *   Green Data Storage, Data Centers and Cloud Computing, Content Distribution Networks

*   **Artificial Intelligence based Communications & Networking (AICN)**
    *   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile and wearable computing
    *   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile enterprises and eCommerce
    *   Artificial Intelligence and Ubiquitous collaborative & social services
    *   Artificial Intelligence for Internet-of-things and edge computing
    *   Artificial Intelligence and Cyber-physical integration
    *   Artificial Intelligence and Big data analytics for mobility-enabled services
    *   Artificial Intelligence for Mobile Health and Services
    *   Large Language Model for Wireless and Mobile Networks

*   **Blockchain and Cryptocurrency in Mobile Networks (BCMN)**
    *   Distributed Trust
    *   Decentralised Internet Infrastructure
    *   Decentralised Financial Services
    *   Blockchain for Internet of Things/Cyber Physical Services
    *   Blockchain and Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
    *   Blockchain for Metaverse and Digital Twins
    *   Distributed Consensus and Fault Tolerance Algorithms
    *   Blockchain Platforms & Offchain Technologies
    *   Decentralized Finance and payments

*   **Trust, Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks (SWMN)**
    *   Computer and Network Forensics
    *   Cross-layer Design Security
    *   Cryptographic Algorithms and Applications
    *   Identity Management, Key distribution and management
    *   Information System Security
    *   Intrusion Detection and Prevention
    *   Mobile and Wireless Network Security
    *   Network Security Protocol Design
    *   Other Topics on Security on Wireless and Mobile Networks
    *   Physical Layer Security
    *   Privacy and Security in Clouds and Contents Distribution Networks
    *   Resource Allocation, Incentives, and Game-Theoretic Models
    *   Security and Privacy in Crowd Sensing and Crowd Sourcing
    *   Security and Privacy of Big Data
    *   Security and Privacy of Cloud Services
    *   Security of Cyber Physical Systems
    *   Security of Femtocells and Macrocells
    *   Security of Mobile Multimedia and Cloud Media
    *   Security, Trust and Privacy of Internet of Things
    *   Smart Grids Security
    *   Smart Phone Security and Privacy
    *   Threat and Vulnerability Analysis for Mobile Communication
    *   Trust Models, Security Modeling and Protocol Design
    *   Trust, Privacy and Security: Application, Network and MAC layers.

## Important Dates

*   **Main Conference Paper Submission Date:** **June 25, 2025** (Firm deadline, extended from June 1, 2025)
*   **Main Conference Notifications Date:** **July 30, 2025**
*   **Main Conference Camera Ready Date:** **September 15, 2025**
*   **Main Conference Registrations for Authors:** **September 15, 2025**
*   **Workshop proposals submission due:** **March 25, 2025**
*   **Notification of acceptance of workshop proposals:** **March 31, 2025**
*   **Workshop paper submission due:** **July 15, 2025**
*   **Decision on accepting workshop papers:** **August 15, 2025**
*   **Workshop Camera ready & Author Registration:** **September 1, 2025**
*   **Short Papers, Posters & Demos Submission due:** **July 1, 2025**
*   **Short Papers, Posters & Demos Notification of Acceptance:** **August 15, 2025**
*   **Short Papers, Posters & Demos Camera ready & Author Registration:** **September 1, 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** Authors are required to submit fully formatted, original papers in **PDF format**, conforming to the IEEE standard conference format (two-column, 10 pt font, including figures, tables, and references).
*   **Page Limits:** Review submissions are limited to **six pages**. Final papers can extend up to **eight pages** (additional charges may apply for pages beyond six).
*   **Language:** Papers should be written in English.
*   **Submission System:** Only timely submissions through EDAS will be accepted. You can access EDAS via the official WiMob'2025 website or by following the link provided for submission.
*   **Presentation:** Each accepted paper must be presented at the conference by one of the co-authors or a third party. Papers not presented will not be indexed and archived through IEEE Xplore.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore**, subject to meeting IEEE Xplore's scope and quality requirements.

## Contact Information

For any inquiries, please contact the WiMob 2025 Organizing committee via email: [wimob2025@wimob.org](mailto:wimob2025@wimob.org).

The WiMob conference also solicits papers for workshops, short papers, posters, and demos. Please refer to the respective calls for details.

summary: The 13th World Conference on Information Systems and Technologies (WorldCIST'25) will be held in Florianópolis, Brazil, at the Majestic Palace Hotel from April 15-17, 2025. The conference is a forum for researchers and practitioners to discuss innovations and trends in Information Systems and Technologies and is a CORE conference with a Google Scholar H5-Index of 25. Accepted full and short papers will be published by Springer in the Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems series and submitted for indexation by various databases.
callForPapers:
# WorldCIST'25: Call For Papers

The WorldCist'25 - 13th World Conference on Information Systems and Technologies will be held in **Florianopolis, Santa Catarina, Brazil**, at the **Federal University of Santa Catarina (UFSC)**, from **April 15 - 17, 2025**.

This conference is a global forum for researchers and practitioners to present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, results, experiences, and concerns in the various perspectives of Information Systems and Technologies.

## Submission Themes

Submitted papers should be related to one or more of the following main themes:

*   **A) Information and Knowledge Management (IKM)**
*   **B) Organizational Models and Information Systems (OMIS)**
*   **C) Software and Systems Modeling (SSM)**
*   **D) Software Systems, Architectures, Applications and Tools (SSAAT)**
*   **E) Multimedia Systems and Applications (MSA)**
*   **F) Computer Networks, Mobility and Pervasive Systems (CNMPS)**
*   **G) Intelligent and Decision Support Systems (IDSS)**
*   **H) Big Data Analytics and Applications (BDAA)**
*   **I) Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)**
*   **J) Ethics, Computers and Security (ECS)**
*   **K) Health Informatics (HIS)**
*   **L) Information Technologies in Education (ITE)**
*   **M) Technologies for Biomedical Applications (TBA)**
*   **N) Information Technologies in Radiocommunications (ITR)**

## Types of Submissions and Decisions

Four types of original papers can be submitted:

1.  **Full paper:** Finished or consolidated R&D works. Assigned a **12-page limit**. Included in Conference proceedings and submitted for indexing.
2.  **Short paper:** Ongoing works with relevant preliminary results, open to discussion. Assigned an **8-page limit**. Included in Conference proceedings and submitted for indexing.
3.  **Poster paper:** Initial work with relevant ideas, open to discussion. Assigned a **4-page limit**. Presented at the conference, but not published in proceedings.
4.  **Company paper:** Companies' papers that show practical experience, R & D, tools, etc. Assigned an **8-page limit**. Presented at the conference, but not published in proceedings.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submitted papers must comply with the format of Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems series. Refer to [Instructions for Authors at Springer Website](https://www.springer.com/us/authors-editors/conference-proceedings/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   Papers must not have been published before, nor be under review for any other conference or publication.
*   **Blind Review:** Papers must not include any information leading to the authors’ identification (names, affiliations, bibliographic references). This information should only be included in the camera-ready version.
*   Submitted papers will be reviewed based on relevance, originality, importance, and clarity by at least two members of the Program Committee.
*   All papers will be subjected to a “double-blind review”.

## Publication and Indexing

*   Full and Short papers accepted and registered will be published in Proceedings by **Springer**, in the **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems** series.
*   Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by **Scopus, WoS, DBLP, Google Scholar**, among others, and will be available in the SpringerLink Digital Library.
*   Authors of the best selected papers will be invited to extend them for publication in international journals.
*   To ensure publication/presentation, at least one author must be fully registered by **January 15, 2025**, and the paper must comply with the suggested layout and page-limit. All recommended changes must be addressed before submitting the camera-ready version.
*   No more than one paper per registration will be published. An extra fee must be paid for publication of additional papers.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission:** December 5, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** January 5, 2025
*   **Registration:** January 15, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Submission:** January 15, 2025

## Workshops

WorldCist also includes several workshops focused on specific scientific subjects within the conference scope, including:

*   AGAI&BI 2025
*   AIEd 2025
*   EDA 2025
*   ECSHA 2025
*   WEd5.0 2025
*   AIM&ABIA 2025
*   WDTAI 2025
*   CEDXREdu 2025
*   WDMCTA 2025
*   ISCST 2025
*   ROMS 2025
*   ESEP 2025
*   DPPMT 2025
*   WBM&NTF 2025
*   DDSAIPAGM 2025

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Gintautas Dzemyda** (Vilnius University Institute of Data Science and Digital Technologies, Lithuania)
*   **Marjan Mernik** (University of Maribor, Slovenia)

## Contact

For inquiries, please refer to the contact information on the conference website.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: APLAS 2025

Welcome to the website of the **23rd Asian Symposium on Programming Languages and Systems (APLAS) 2025**.

APLAS 2025 will occur from **October 27 to 30, 2025**, in **Bengaluru, India**, at the **International Institute of Information Technology Bangalore (IIIT Bangalore)**. This year’s conference is co-located with the 23rd edition of the International Symposium on Automated Technology for Verification and Analysis (ATVA 2025).

We are proud to announce Prof. Dr. Peter Müller as our plenary joint keynote for APLAS and ATVA 2025!

## Scope and Topics of Interest

We solicit submissions in the form of regular research papers describing original scientific research results, including system development and case studies. Solicited topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Programming paradigms and styles: functional, object-oriented, probabilistic, logic, constraint programming; extensible programming languages; programming languages for systems code; novel programming paradigms.
*   Methods and tools to specify and reason about programs and languages: programming techniques; meta-programming; domain-specific languages; proof assistants; type systems; dependent types; program logics, static and dynamic program analysis; language-based security; model checking; testing.
*   Programming language foundations: formal semantics; type theory; logical foundations; category theory; automata; effects; monads and comonads; recursion and corecursion; continuations and effect handlers; program verification; memory models; abstract interpretation.
*   Methods and tools for implementation: compilers; program transformations; rewriting systems; partial evaluation; virtual machines; refactoring; intermediate languages; run-time environments; garbage collection and memory management; tracing; profiling; build systems; program synthesis.
*   Concurrency and distribution: process algebras; concurrency theory; session types; parallel programming; service-oriented computing; distributed and mobile computing; actor-based languages; verification and testing of concurrent and distributed systems.
*   Applications and emerging topics: programming languages and PL methods in education, security, privacy, database systems, computational biology, signal processing, graphics, human-computer interaction, computer-aided design, artificial intelligence and machine learning; case studies in program analysis and verification.

## Submission Information

*   Submissions should not exceed **17 pages**, excluding bibliography, in the **Springer LNCS format**.
*   The LaTeX template is available at [Springer’s Information for Authors](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   Accepted papers will be allowed **one extra page** to accommodate reviewers’ feedback.
*   Additional material intended for reviewers but not for publication in the final version (e.g., details of proofs) may be placed in a clearly marked appendix that is not included in the page limit. Reviewers are not obligated to review it.
*   Submitted papers must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere. Papers must be written in English.
*   Accepted papers must be presented at the conference.
*   Authors can refer to [Springer Nature Code of Conduct for Authors](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/book-authors-code-of-conduct).
*   Papers should be submitted via HotCRP: [https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/](https://aplas25.hotcrp.com/)

## Reviewing Process

APLAS uses a **light double-blind reviewing process**, with a rebuttal phase, to address factual errors and minor misunderstandings. Reviewers will not see author names until they submit a review. Authors must adhere to the following rules:

*   Omit your names and institutions.
*   Refer to your prior work in the third person, just as you refer to prior work by others.
*   Omit the acknowledgments.

Nothing should be done in the name of anonymity that weakens the submission or makes reviewing the paper more difficult (e.g., important background references should not be omitted or anonymized). Authors may post drafts of their papers on the web or give talks on their research ideas. For more details, see the FAQ: [https://2025.splashcon.org/track/OOPSLA#faq](https://2025.splashcon.org/track/OOPSLA#faq).

## Publication

The proceedings will be published as a volume in **Springer’s LNCS series**. Previous APLAS proceedings can be found on [SpringerLink](https://link.springer.com/conference/aplas). Authors interested in making their contributions Open Access can refer to [Springer’s webpage](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/open-access-publishing-in-computer-proceedings) for additional information.

## Best Paper Award

APLAS continues the tradition of the best paper award. The award will be announced on the website, and printed certificates will be issued to the authors at the conference.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Submission Deadline:** Sat 7 Jun 2025
*   **Author Response Period:** Mon 7 - Wed 9 Jul 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** Fri 18 Jul 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Sun 31 Aug 2025

## Contact

For general inquiries, please use the [contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact/aplas-2025).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## About ARITH 2025

The **32nd IEEE International Symposium on Computer Arithmetic (ARITH 2025)** will be held in **El Paso, TX, USA**, from **May 4-7, 2025**. ARITH is the premier conference for presenting scientific work on the latest research in computer arithmetic, driving innovation in domains such as artificial intelligence, high-performance computing, signal processing, and security.

## Topics of Interest

ARITH 2025 welcomes submissions related to computer arithmetic, including but not restricted to:

*   **Arithmetic foundations, systems and formats:** Theory of computer arithmetic such as integer, fixed/floating-point, interval, finite-field, etc.; Novel arithmetic systems and application-specific number formats.
*   **Implementation of arithmetic:** Novel architecture of arithmetic units on various technologies including traditional, FPGA, optical and quantum; High-performance, low-power and fault-tolerant designs and implementations; Design tools and methodologies, including testing and formal verification.
*   **Algorithms and numerics:** Computer approximations of elementary and special functions; Arithmetic algorithms and their analysis; Design, compilation, optimization, validation, and verification of numerical software.
*   **Application-specific arithmetic:** Cryptography or security; Artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning; Signal processing, multimedia, and computer graphics.

All topics that relate to intensive use of computer arithmetic are welcome.

## Submission Guidelines

### Paper Types and Length

*   **Full papers:** Should not exceed **8 pages** (no extra pages) for the final submission. For review purposes, full papers may be submitted with up to 20 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.
*   **Short and industry papers:** Should not exceed **4 pages** (no extra pages) for the final submission. For review purposes, these may be submitted with up to 10 pages, using 12pt font size, single column, and double spacing.

### Formatting

*   Submissions must be in English and adhere to the IEEE Computer Society Conference format (two columns).
*   For formatting instructions, please refer to: [http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](http://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)

### Submission Portal

*   Submissions must be made through the EasyChair website: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=arith2025)

### Review Process

*   The review process for ARITH 2025 is **double-blind**.
*   Author names, affiliations, and grants must be anonymized in submitted papers.
*   Self-references should be handled as third-party references.
*   Papers not complying with this policy will be administratively rejected. Non-anonymous preprints or code repositories are discouraged.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** December 13, 2024
*   **Paper submission deadline:** December 23, 2024
*   **Reviews completed and Authors notified:** February 14, 2025
*   **Registration start date:** February 17th, 2025
*   **Early registration deadline:** April 4th, 2025
*   **Late registration deadline:** May 3rd, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** May 4-7, 2025

## Publication

Accepted papers will be presented at the conference and included in the conference proceedings and in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library.

## Contact

For inquiries, please contact: [slides@arith2025.org](mailto:slides@arith2025.org) or [contact@arith2025.org](mailto:contact@arith2025.org)

callForPapers:
# Broadnets 2025: Call for Papers

The **16th International Conference on Broadband Communications, Networks, and Systems (Broadnets 2025)** will take place from **August 14-16, 2025, in Sunyani, Ghana**.

The conference focuses on cutting-edge research and technological advancements in next-generation communication networks, artificial intelligence-driven security mechanisms, and intelligent systems. It aims to provide a platform for researchers, industry professionals, and policymakers to explore innovative solutions in 5G/6G networks, IoT-enabled smart systems, speech and signal processing, cybersecurity, and edge computing.

## Scope and Topics

The conference seeks novel, innovative, and exciting work in areas including but not limited to:

*   5G/6G and Use Cases of 5G/6G Systems
*   Software-Defined Networking (SDN)-Enabled Systems
*   Internet of Things (IoT)-Enabled Smart Systems
*   Cloud-to-Things Systems
*   Edge Cooperative Computing and Fog Computing
*   Vehicular Networks
*   Smart City and Smart Grid Applications
*   Digital Twin Technology
*   Speech and Signal Processing for secure communications, speech enhancement, audio analytics, and intelligent voice-based applications
*   Distributed Systems Security
*   Trust and Access Control
*   Data Privacy and Integrity

Key areas of interest include network architectures, distributed computing, digital twin technologies, vehicular communication, trust and privacy mechanisms, and AI-driven anomaly detection. The conference will also highlight advancements in speech and signal processing techniques, particularly in secure communications, speech enhancement, and audio analytics for real-time applications.

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** April 15th, 2025
*   **Notification deadline:** May 10th, 2025
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** June 14th, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers must be submitted in English.
*   Previously published work cannot be submitted, nor can it be concurrently submitted to any other conference or journal. Such papers will be rejected without review.
*   Papers must follow the Springer formatting guidelines (available in the Author’s Kit section).
*   Authors must read and agree to the [Publication Ethics and Malpractice Statement](https://eai.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/How-to-Write-Good-Alt-Text-2.pdf).
*   As per new EU accessibility requirements, all figures, illustrations, tables, and images should have descriptive text accompanying them. Please refer to the guide on [HOW TO WRITE GOOD ALT TEXT](https://eai.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/How-to-Write-Good-Alt-Text-2.pdf).

## Paper Submission

*   Papers should be submitted through EAI 'Confy+' system.
*   Regular papers should be up to **12-15+ pages** in length.
*   Short papers should be **6-11 pages** in length.

All conference papers undergo a thorough peer review process by experts in the Technical Program Committee.

## Author’s Kit – Instructions and Templates

Papers must be formatted using the Springer LNICST Authors’ Kit.

Instructions and templates are available from [Springer’s LNICST homepage](https://www.springer.com/series/10309):

*   [LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates (zip)](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-authors-editors/manuscript-submission/types-of-manuscripts/proceedings/latex-templates)
*   [Microsoft Word Proceedings Templates (zip)](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-authors-editors/manuscript-submission/types-of-manuscripts/proceedings/word-templates)

When uploading the camera-ready copy, please upload both:
*   a PDF copy of your paper formatted according to the templates.
*   an archive file (e.g. zip, tar.gz) containing both a PDF copy of your paper and LaTeX or Word source material prepared according to the guidelines.

## Publication

All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by **Springer** and made available through **SpringerLink Digital Library**.

Proceedings will be submitted for inclusion in leading indexing services, such as Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, IO-Port, MathSciNet, Inspec, and Zentralblatt MATH.

Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:
*   **Springer Wireless Networks (WINET) Journal** [IF: 2.1 (2023)]

All accepted authors are eligible to submit an extended version in a fast track of:
*   **EAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications**

Authors also have the opportunity to publish their articles in the EAI Endorsed Transactions journal (Scopus, Ei-indexed, ESCI-WoS, Compendex) by paying an additional **$150** (discounted from the standard $250 rate for conference authors).
*   **EAI Endorsed Transactions on Scalable Information Systems** (ESCI-WoS, Compendex)

**Requirements for extended versions:**
*   It must be an extended version of the conference paper with a different title and abstract. In general, 30% of new content must be added.
*   The article will be processed once the conference proceedings have been published.
*   The article will be processed using the fast-track option.

Additional publication opportunities include:
*   EAI Transactions series (Open Access)
*   EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series

callForPapers:
# CIDR 2026: Call for Papers

## Overview

The annual Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR) is a systems-oriented conference, complementary in its mission to the mainstream database conferences like SIGMOD and VLDB, emphasizing the systems architecture perspective. CIDR gathers researchers and practitioners from both academia and industry to discuss the latest innovative and visionary ideas in the field.

We invite contributions on novel approaches to data management systems, architecture, and usage including cloud based systems for data processing as well as related system issues such as data storage, networking, hardware acceleration, custom processors, memory hierarchies, processor interconnects, etc. in the context of data processing. We also encourage new approaches to data management and system building based on or in support of ML/AI technologies. CIDR encourages contributions about innovative and risky data management system architecture ideas, systems-building experience and insights, resourceful experimental studies, and provocative position statements. CIDR especially values innovation, experience-based insight, and vision.

## Contribution Types

CIDR 2026 invites two kinds of contributions:

*   **Papers** (at most 6 pages). We invite both regular research papers and more visionary papers that promote interesting ideas and ongoing work.
*   **Demos** (a video or a description of the demo in at most 6 pages).

To encourage authors to submit only their best work, each person can be an author or co-author of at most one submission of any kind. Authors who feel their work is best captured through a demo should submit a demo proposal. Demos and papers will be interweaved in a single-tracked program.

## Important Dates

(all deadlines are 11:59pm Pacific Time)

*   **August 5th, 2025:** submission deadline for all contributions
*   **October 6th, 2025:** author notification for all contributions
*   **January 18-21, 2026:** conference

## Submission

*   Papers should be electronically submitted in PDF format to [CMT](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIDR2026).
*   Conference submissions must be formatted using the double-column ACM sigconf style (see the ACM Template), and must not exceed 6 pages in length including all references and appendix.
*   Videos can be submitted in HTML or MPEG format.
*   Submissions will be reviewed by the program committee, who will select the final program in co-operation with the organizing committee.
*   At least one author of an accepted paper or demo will be expected to attend the conference in person to present the paper.

## Camera-Ready Guidelines

Camera-ready papers need to follow the formatting instructions above. Additionally, they need to include the following copyright notice at the bottom left of the first page:

> This paper is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY 4.0) license. Authors reserve their rights to disseminate the work on their personal and corporate Web sites with the appropriate attribution, provided that you attribute the original work to the authors and CIDR 2026. 16th Annual Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR '26). January 18-21, 2026, Chaminade, USA.

*   This LaTeX style file (cidr-2026.cls) and this Word template file (pubform-CIDR2026.docx) include the copyright notice. We recommend that you use them. Both will display the copyright notice.

## Diversity and Inclusion

As a large scientific and technical community that has a direct impact on many people from different backgrounds around the world, Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) are crucial for the data management community. Please refer to D&I in DB for the details of the coordinated D&I efforts across our community. Paper writing can make a material difference. So, we would like to strongly plead with the authors to follow the D&I writing instructions when drafting the paper submissions.

---

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: CCC 2025

## Submission Deadline
**Friday, February 7, 2025**, 23:59 AoE

## Scope
The conference seeks original research papers in all areas of computational complexity theory, studying the absolute and relative power of computational models under resource constraints. We welcome contributions from all topics with connections to or motivated by questions in complexity theory, broadly construed. We especially encourage submissions that address complexity-theoretic issues in complexity-adjacent areas such as coding theory, cryptography, game theory, learning, logic and privacy.

Possible topics include but are not limited to:

*   Complexity classes
*   Reducibility and completeness
*   Circuit complexity
*   Communication complexity
*   Algebraic complexity
*   Proof complexity
*   Complexity in other concrete computational models
*   Interactive and probabilistic proof systems
*   Logic and descriptive complexity
*   Pseudorandomness and derandomization
*   Average case complexity
*   Quantum computation
*   Parametrized complexity
*   Fine-grained complexity
*   Complexity-theoretic aspects of:
    *   coding theory
    *   cryptography
    *   optimization (including inapproximability, continuous optimization)
    *   property testing
    *   streaming and sublinear computation
    *   distributed computation
    *   game theory
    *   machine learning
    *   privacy

## Submission
### Deadlines
*   **Submission Deadline:** Friday, February 7, 2025, 23:59 AoE
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Friday, May 2, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Copy Due:** End of May, 2025

### Submission Server
Papers must be submitted electronically via the submission server: [ccc2025.hotcrp.com](https://ccc2025.hotcrp.com/)

### Format
*   Submissions should start with a title page consisting of the title of the paper and an abstract of 1-2 paragraphs summarizing the paper's contributions.
*   A submission must contain within its first 10 pages a clear presentation of the merits of the paper, including discussion of its importance, prior work, and an outline of key technical ideas and methods used to achieve the main claims.
*   Material other than the abstract, references, and the first 10 pages is considered supplementary and will be read at the committee's discretion.
*   Submissions should include proofs of all central claims.
*   The submission should be in single-column format, use at least 11-point font, at least 1-inch margins, and at least single-spacing between lines. Submissions deviating significantly from these guidelines risk rejection without consideration of their merits.
*   Instructions for formatting camera-ready versions will be communicated to the authors of accepted papers.

### Review Process
The conference will employ a **lightweight double-blind reviewing process**. Submissions should not reveal the identity of the authors in any way. Authors' names, affiliations, and email addresses should not appear at the beginning or in the body of the submission. Authors are encouraged to post their papers to arXiv/ECCC/IACR etc. Important references should not be omitted or anonymized.

### Additional Remarks
Authors may optionally send a short email to the program committee (PC) chair at `ccc2025chair@gmail.com` containing any additional remarks for the PC. Submissions involving PC members are not allowed.

### Conflict of Interest (COI)
PC members and reviewers are expected to recuse themselves from evaluating submissions if they have a conflict of interest (e.g., thesis advisor, close collaborator, recent shared affiliation). Authors can write to the PC chair at `ccc2025chair@gmail.com` if there is a COI that may not be covered.

### Simultaneous Submission Policy
Material previously published or scheduled for publication prior to September 2025, or simultaneously submitted to another conference with published proceedings, will not be considered.

### Confidentiality
All submissions will be treated as confidential and disclosed only to the committee and their sub-referees.

## Publication
### Online Posting
Authors are encouraged to post full versions of their submissions in a freely accessible on-line repository such as the [Electronic Colloquium on Computational Complexity (ECCC)](http://eccc.hpi-web.de/eccc) or the arXiv.

### Proceedings
The conference proceedings will be published under a Creative Commons BY license in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series. Publication in the proceedings does not preclude subsequent journal publication.

## Presentation
Authors of accepted papers are expected to present their work at the conference. Time allocations for presentations will be between 15 and 45 minutes.

## Awards
*   **EATCS Luca Trevisan award for the CCC best student paper:** Awarded to the best paper written solely by one or more students. Authors must indicate eligibility via the submission page.
*   **Best paper award:** Awarded to the best paper submitted. Full versions of these papers may be invited for submission to the Journal of the ACM.

## Special Journal Issue
The program committee will invite full versions of a select number of conference submissions to a special issue of the journal *Computational Complexity*.

## Conference Information
*   **Dates:** Tuesday, August 5 to Friday, August 8, 2025
*   **Location:** Toronto, Canada
*   **Travel Allowances:** Travel allowances will be offered to students and post-doctoral fellows. More information will be available on the conference webpage.
*   **Visas:** A visa for Canada may be needed for some citizens. Please contact your local Canadian consulate as soon as possible and the local arrangements committee if you need a letter to obtain your visa.
*   **Code of Conduct:** CCC 2025 is a participant in the SafeTOC initiative and is committed to providing an environment free of discrimination and harassment.

## Program Committee
*   Paul Beame, University of Washington
*   Anna Gál, University of Texas at Austin
*   Sumegha Garg, Rutgers University
*   Joshua Grochow, University of Colorado Boulder
*   Shuichi Hirahara, National Institute of Informatics
*   Holger Dell, Goethe-Universität Frankfurt and IT University of Copenhagen
*   Igor Carboni Oliveira, University of Warwick
*   Amir Shpilka, Tel Aviv University
*   Makrand Sinha, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
*   Srikanth Srinivasan (Chair), University of Copenhagen and IIT Bombay
*   Avishay Tal, University of California Berkeley
*   Madhur Tulsiani, Toyota Technological Institute at Chicago

## Local Arrangements Committee
*   Swastik Kopparty (Chair), University of Toronto
*   Benjamin Rossman, Duke University

## Board of Trustees
*   Amit Chakrabarti, Dartmouth College
*   Mahdi Cheraghchi, University of Michigan
*   Valentine Kabanets, Simon Fraser University
*   Antonina Kolokolova, Memorial University of Newfoundland
*   Nutan Limaye, IT-University of Copenhagen
*   Shachar Lovett (President), University of California San Diego
*   Raghu Meka, University of California Los Angeles
*   Susanna de Rezende, Lund University
*   Benjamin Rossman, Duke University
*   Shubhangi Saraf, University of Toronto

## Questions?
Please contact Srikanth Srinivasan at `ccc2025chair@gmail.com`.

callForPapers:
# CiE 2025: Call for Papers

Computability in Europe (CiE) is an interdisciplinary series of international conferences organized by the Association Computability in Europe (ACiE). CiE 2025 will be held from **July 14-18, 2025, in Lisbon**.

The conference welcomes research contributions on computability-related fields of science, including:

*   Mathematics
*   Theoretical Computer Science
*   Logic
*   Quantum Computability
*   Cryptography
*   Information Theory
*   Computational Biology
*   Computational Linguistics
*   History and Philosophy of Computability
*   and many other related subjects.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** January 26, 2025 (AoE) - CLOSED
*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** February 2, 2025 (AoE) - CLOSED
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 6, 2025
*   **Final Versions Due:** April 13, 2025
*   **Deadline for Informal Presentations Submission:** April 22, 2025 (Notifications sent a few days after submission) - CLOSED
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** Before May 6, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 14-18, 2025

## Special Offer for Junior Women Researchers

As part of the Women in Computability program, support is offered for junior women researchers to join CiE 2025. See details [here](https://sites.google.com/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).

## Student Accommodations

Limited offer: 20 rooms available for students at €160 per week. First come, first served! More information [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/accommodations).

## Student Travel Support

The Association for Symbolic Logic will support the travels of some students. More information [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/registration).

## Sponsors

This event is funded by national funds through the FCT – Fundação para a Ciência e a Tecnologia, I.P., under the scope of various projects.

## WiC (Women in Computability)

Details available [here](/view/cie2025-computabilityineurope/wic).

callForPapers:
# IEEE-EMBS BSN 2025: Call for Technical Papers

The IEEE-EMBS International Conference on Body Sensor Networks (BSN 2025) will be held in **Los Angeles, California, USA**, from **November 3 – 5, 2025**. The conference theme is **“Computational Medicine: Expanding Health through Sensing and AI.”**

BSN 2025 will provide a cross-disciplinary, highly selective, single-track forum for cutting-edge research related to devices and sensors, hardware and software systems, predictive models, and data analytics in the healthcare/medical domains.

## Submission Types and Guidelines

*   **Regular 4-page technical papers**
*   **1-page technical abstracts**
*   **1-page clinical abstracts**

All page limits include references. Papers are required to follow the **IEEE Conference template format**.

BSN adopts a **single-blind review process**, allowing authors to include their names and affiliations in the submission.

## Topics of Interest

*   Novel digital health solutions (i.e., sensors and algorithms) for diagnosis, disease progress tracking, and self-management.
*   Sensors and systems for digital health, wellness, and athletics.
*   Conformable decoders: unintrusive, comfortable, self-powered sensors and systems.
*   Flexible, stretchable, and imperceptible electronics for sensors and systems.
*   Contact-less solutions for human sensing.
*   Power-optimization for implantable and wearable sensors and systems.
*   Wearable robotics system for digital healthcare.
*   Signal processing, machine learning, deep learning, and decision-support algorithms.
*   Adaptive, personalized intervention systems by closing the loop between technologies and humans.
*   Security, privacy, and trust in digital health technologies.
*   Optimization and personalization for digital health technologies and outcomes.
*   Human-centered design for digital healthcare to address real-world stakeholder needs.
*   Emerging topics such as Agentic AI and LLMs for computational health

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal Deadline:** June 15, 2025
*   **Workshop Acceptance Notification:** June 29, 2025
*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
*   **Abstract, Clinical abstracts, and Demo Submission Deadline:** July 11, 2025
*   **Paper Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
*   **Abstract Acceptance Notification:** August 1, 2025
*   **Late Breaking Abstract Deadline:** August 10, 2025
*   **Late Breaking Abstract Notification:** August 24, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** September 1, 2025
*   **Conference:** November 3-5, 2025

*All deadlines are 11:59 pm AoE (Anywhere on Earth).* 

## Awards and Recognition

*   Best paper, poster, and demo awards recognizing excellent contributions.
*   Excellent papers will be invited for extension and rapid review at the **IEEE Open Journal of Engineering in Medicine and Biology**.
*   **Student Travel Awards** will be provided to selected students from worldwide institutions.

## Submission Portal

Submit your 4-page technical paper here: [https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles](https://openreview.net/group?id=IEEE.org/EMBS/BSN/2025/Conference&referrer=%5BHomepage%5D(%2F)#tab-your-consoles)

## Presenter Guidelines

Refer to the [Presenter Guidelines](https://bsn.embs.org/2025/author-instructions/) for detailed information.
